column2: Project Role : Application Developer Project Role Description : Design, build and configure applications to meet business process and application requirements.  Must have skills : Selenium Good to have skills : NA Minimum  3  year(s) of experience is required Educational Qualification : Minimum 15years of fulltime education Summary :As an Application Developer, you will be responsible for designing, building, and configuring applications to meet business process and application requirements. Your typical day will involve working with Selenium and ensuring the quality of the applications being developed.  Roles & Responsibilities: Design, develop, and maintain automated test scripts using Selenium. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and resolve defects and issues. Develop and execute test plans and test cases to ensure the quality of the applications being developed. Create and maintain test data and test environments to support testing activities. Participate in code reviews and provide feedback to improve the quality of the code being developed. Professional & Technical Skills: Proficiency in Selenium. Experience with test automation frameworks such as TestNG or JUnit. Strong understanding of software testing methodologies and best practices. Experience with Agile development methodologies. Experience with defect tracking tools such as JIRA or Bugzilla. Additional Information: The candidate should have a minimum of 3 years of experience in Selenium. The ideal candidate will possess a strong educational background in computer science or a related field, along with a proven track record of delivering high-quality software solutions. This position is based at our Hyderabad office. Qualification Minimum 15years of fulltime education

column2: We are looking for a Quality Analyst who has a minimum 2 years of experience in Manual testing for web and mobile applications, who can work independently as well as in a team, and is well versed in designing test cases and executing them as per the test plans drawn in coordination with Test Lead. Hands-on experience with Bug tracking and Project Management tool JIRA.     Proficient in testing Web applications. Hands-on experience in API testing      Involved in retesting regression testing, validation of fixes, and maintenance of bug tracking documentation.     Daily scrum meeting to discuss issues and daily tasks. column2: API Testing is a type of software testing that involves testing application programming interfaces (APIs) to ensure that they are functioning correctly and meeting their specified requirements. The following are the key responsibilities of an API Tester:     1.Design and execute test cases: The API Tester is responsible for designing and executing test cases to validate the functionality and performance of APIs.     2.Verify API results: The API Tester is responsible for verifying the results of API requests to ensure that they are accurate and meet the specified requirements.     3.The API Tester is responsible for debugging API issues and working with development teams to resolve them.     4.The API Tester is responsible for ensuring that APIs are secure and protecting sensitive information.Requirements Experience in software testing. Knowledge of API testing tools and techniques, as well as experience with programming languages such as Java, Python, or C++, is also essential for success in this role.

column2: What You'll Do       As a Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET) at Avalara, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the quality and reliability of our tax compliance software solutions. You will collaborate with development teams to design, implement, and execute automated test scripts, perform manual testing when necessary, and contribute to the continuous improvement of our testing processes.           Develop and maintain automated test scripts using industry-standard tools and frameworks.   Collaborate with software developers and quality assurance engineers to identify test requirements and design test cases.   Execute test cases manually and through automation, ensuring thorough coverage of functional and non-functional requirements.   Analyze test results, identify defects, and work with cross-functional teams to resolve issues in a timely manner.   Participate in Agile development practices, including sprint planning, daily stand-ups, and retrospective meetings.   Contribute to the improvement of testing processes, tools, and techniques to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.   Stay updated with industry trends and best practices in software testing and quality assurance.     What You'll Need to be Successful       Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.     5+ years of experience in software testing, with a focus on test automation and quality assurance       Strong programming skills in languages like Java, C#, Python, or similar languages used for test automation     Experience with automated testing frameworks like Selenium, Appium, or JUnit.   Familiarity with Agile methodologies and tools such as Jira or Azure DevOps.   Knowledge of software testing principles, techniques, and best practices.   Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.   Strong communication and collaboration abilities, with a focus on teamwork and continuous learning.     About Avalara       We re Avalara. We re defining the relationship between tax and tech.                We ve already built an industry-leading cloud compliance platform, processing nearly 40 billion customer API calls and over 5 million tax returns a year.                Last year, we became a billion-dollar business ,  and our tribe expanded by a cool thousand people - there s nearly 5,000 of us now.  Our growth is real, and we re not slowing down - not until we ve achieved our mission - to be part of every transaction in the world.               We re bright, innovative and disruptive, like the orange we love to wear.  It captures our quirky spirit and optimistic mindset. It shows off the culture we ve designed, that empowers our people to win. Ownership and achievement go hand in hand here. We instill passion in our people through the trust we place in them.               We ve been different from day one. Join us, and your career will be too.                           EEO Statement           We re an Equal Opportunity Employer. Supporting diversity and inclusion is a cornerstone of our company   we don t want people to fit into our culture, but to enrich it. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, age, gender, national orientation, disability, sexual orientation, US Veteran status, or any other factor protected by law. If you require any reasonable adjustments during the recruitment process, please let us know.       Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.     5+ years of experience in software testing, with a focus on test automation and quality assurance       Strong programming skills in languages like Java, C#, Python, or similar languages used for test automation     Experience with automated testing frameworks like Selenium, Appium, or JUnit.   Familiarity with Agile methodologies and tools such as Jira or Azure DevOps.   Knowledge of software testing principles, techniques, and best practices.   Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.   Strong communication and collaboration abilities, with a focus on teamwork and continuous learning.    UNAVAILABLE

column2: The Test Engineering role is responsible for ensuring that all applications, system products, projects, and solutions meet defined enterprise quality standards. Provide centralized, independent quality assurance services across the firm, including functional and non-functional testing for all products, services, and applications across businesses. Design, develop, and maintain automated testing solutions, providing testing expertise, oversight, and direction to ensure the functionality of solutions and that design specifications are met. Your Responsibilities Responsible for system integration testing, including automation, of newly developed or enhanced applications. Responsible for reviewing requirements and design artifacts, developing unit, integration and system test cases, ensuring extensive test coverage for our cloud application Play an active role in translating business and functional requirements into concrete deliverables Advanced java / Selenium development skills with significant experience applying those skills in test environments. Lead, develop, and advise on test automation strategies and provide critical feedback in requirements, design, implementation and execution phases Expert and hands on automation at all software layers (e.g. UI, services, APIs, etc.) as well as CI/CD technologies (e.g. Cloudbees, Jenkins, Cucumber, Git, JUnit, Jira, etc.). Develop and improve next generation Test Engineering Automation solutions in a Continuous Integration environment Experienced in an Agile/DevOps environment in collaboration with BAs, product owners and application developers. Define, design, development, documentation and maintenance of tools and Automation Frameworks for current and next gen Software Platforms/Frameworks as part of an Agile team Partner with different stake holders - Product Management, Application Development, DevOps and other technical teams. Contributes to the Automation development of end-to-end regression. Works closely with business and AD domain experts, to continually improve depth and breadth of knowledge for assigned applications/systems. Experienced in mentoring more junior Test engineers, verifying work products and providing guidance as needed. Capable of working on multiple work streams concurrently in a fast-paced environment Must possess excellent verbal and written communication skills with confidence representing QA principles within agile teams. API testing, Python and AWS experience in a plus Requires a functional understanding of distributed and/or mainframe test environments Responsible for Project Coordination and Technical Management tasks **NOTE: The Primary Responsibilities of this role are not limited to the details above. ** Qualifications: Minimum of 7 years of experience with automated unit and integration testing Bachelor's degree and/or equivalent experience preferred Talents Needed for Success: Experienced in Agile/Waterfall, onsite/offshore work model and coordination In depth knowledge of the software implementation lifecycle (specifically the testing model, methodology, and processes), Experience with Test Engineering methodologies and Test Automation Frameworks Extensive experience with testing modern scripting language-based components. Experience with front-end & backend testing Experience in writing sophisticated SQL queries. Experience with JIRA, Microfocus ALM, Bitbucket, Git, and Jenkins Experience with test data management is a plus Detailed understanding of smoke testing, black-box, and non-black box testing, as well as regression testing Experience in estimating, prioritizing, and planning testing activities Requires the ability to work well with both business clients and technical team and the ability to work independently, both individually and as part of a team.

column2: The QNX Test Team is looking for a Software Tester to support system level integration, create and execute tests supporting internal development and customer activities with focus.       In return for your skills, expertise and enthusiasm, we will provide you with an attractive compensation & comprehensive benefits package.      We have some of the brightest minds working on cutting edge platforms at QNX. Join us and you ll become part of a team that is already leading the way and there is no telling what you could accomplish.           You will:           Hands-on configuration, integration and system test of required combinations of:         Virtual frameworks (automotive application)         Target hardware and associated BSPs for silicon partners( ie: Renesas, Intel, NXP, Qualcomm, TI)         Peripherals for digital displays, GPS/navigation, WiFi/BT, sensors, cameras, speakers, etc.         Middleware components for multimedia, navigation, voice recognition, graphics, browser, bluetooth, audio, and smart phone connectivity             Work with concept team to evaluate and prototype new system configurations         Work with developers to investigate and resolve reported problems and provide interim testing support for experimental software         Create or update test plans and test cases based on product requirements, customer requirements or identified problems         Run a series of tests against new software loads on reference or customer hardware and analyzes the results         Create test reports based on test results for internal and external audiences         Work with partners to resolve software/ hardware integration issues         Follow and ensure compliance to workplace operating and environmental, health and safety procedures and guidelines         Collect and document users requirements and develop logical and physical specifications         Research, evaluate and synthesize technical information to design, develop and test computer-based systems         Develop data, process and network models to optimize architecture and to evaluate the performance and reliability of designs         Plan, design and co-ordinate the development, installation, integration and operation of computer-based systems         Assess, test, troubleshoot, document, upgrade and develop maintenance procedures for operating systems, communications environments and applications software         May lead and co-ordinate teams of information systems professionals in the development of software and integrated information systems, process control software and other embedded software control systems.                 If you have the following skills & experience:                 Intermediate to Senior level experience in software testing         Able to discern test requirements from low-level drivers to middleware to user-level applications         Strong working knowledge of embedded integration concepts such as board bring-up, memory management configurations, binary image configuration and creation, process/thread prioritization, security features such as access control policies, and software component integration.         Working knowledge of Python, Embedded C and shell scripting         Working knowledge of Windows, Linux and OS X operating systems         Working knowledge of QNX or other embedded operating system is an asset         Familiarity with common processor architectures (i.e. x86/PPC/ARM/ARMv7)         Familiar with Continuous Integration build systems (Jenkins, Hudson)         Familiar with source versioning, problem reporting and constant integration systems (SVN, Git, JIRA, Jenkins)         Able to write clear and concise problem reports         Ability to work and participate in a team setting with an open, collaborative communication style         Knowledge of formal test theory, test methodology, and experience in developing automated tests and testing tools         Excellent communication, presentation, and organizational skills are necessary         Enthusiasm, a passion for quality and a desire to learn about new technologies is a requirement!

column2: Responsibilities A day in the life of an Infoscion As part of the Infosys consulting team, your primary role would be to actively aid the consulting team in different phases of the project including problem definition, effort estimation, diagnosis, solution generation and design and deployment  You will explore the alternatives to the recommended solutions based on research that includes literature surveys, information available in public domains, vendor evaluation information, etc. and build POCs  You will create requirement specifications from the business needs, define the to-be-processes and detailed functional designs based on requirements. You will support configuring solution requirements on the products; understand if any issues, diagnose the root-cause of such issues, seek clarifications, and then identify and shortlist solution alternatives You will also contribute to unit-level and organizational initiatives with an objective of providing high quality value adding solutions to customers. If you think you fit right in to help our clients navigate their next in their digital transformation journey, this is the place for you!A day in the life of an Infoscion As part of the Infosys testing team, your primary role would be to anchor testing requirements, develop test strategy, track & monitor project plans, review test plans, test cases and test scripts.  You will develop project quality plans, validate defective prevention plans to deliver effective testing solutions for clients. You will ensure right test environment is available and provide necessary review feedback for test data setup to ensure timely commencement of test execution You will validate "go live" activities such as production verification to ensure that the application runs in the production environment without any issues. In addition, you will mentor the team and provide regular feedback and coaching to help them continually improve their performance If you think you fit right in to help our clients navigate their next in their digital transformation journey, this is the place for you! column2: WHAT YOU DO AT AMD CHANGES EVERYTHING              We care deeply about transforming lives with AMD technology to enrich our industry,  our communities,  and the world.  Our mission is to build great products that accelerate next-generation computing experiences   the building blocks for the data center,  artificial intelligence,  PCs,  gaming and embedded.  Underpinning our mission is the AMD culture.  We push the limits of innovation to solve the world s most important challenges.  We strive for execution excellence while being direct,  humble,  collaborative,  and inclusive of diverse perspectives.              AMD together we advance_                    The Role:          This role requires developing,  delivering and supporting IT initiatives for business units.  Through direct interaction with stakeholders and internal business partners,  the person will help drive IT alignment with the team's goals and business needs.  They will also play a key role in defining business requirements and work alongside development teams for the successful execution of IT portfolio projects.            The Person:            The person should have strong communication skills with the ability to help translate the business needs into IT results.          Strong problem-solving abilities to identify potential issues and drive the team to solutions.          The person should possess the desire to tackle additional responsibilities and learn a variety of business models or processes,  such as IT project governance and data analysis.          The person should have the ability to work independently as well as in a team environment.          The person should have experience in SDLC phase and will be a liaison between the business and IT Team and incubate a project right from requirements gathering and manage till implementation and support.             Key Responsibilities:            Facilitate and document business requirements to align business demand with IT understanding.  Bridge gap between business requirements and IT solutions ensuring common understanding and IT/Business alignment.          Review,  analyze,  and evaluate business systems and user needs.         Develop as well as review code updates,  architecture and technical landscape.         Techno-functional understanding and guidance for all platforms including SAAS,  PAAS/IAAS and custom tools.          Possess and develop business acumen to accurately lead business requirements,  build use cases,  storyboarding and testing scenarios.   Document requirements,  flow diagrams,  define scope and objectives,  and formulate systems to parallel overall business strategies.         Prior experience on Coordination with business users,  subject matter experts and developers required.         Analyze system and business data to align with project requirements and functional documentation.         Beyond just capturing business requirements,  tie requirements to decisions that need to be made and to strategic objectives,  or corporate KPI s.         Agile and story boarding experience.  Drive all project management and artifacts to completion to ensure project compliance.         Assist in execution of project life cycle,  including as-is and to be analysis,  scope definition,  process improvement and testing in both Agile and Waterfall methodologies.         Analyze architecture design and provide consultation to IT teams.  Evaluate designs and ensure compliance to business requirements.         Provide technical support and design enhancement for various application.  Assist with problem solving and issue resolution   including partner concern and prioritizations.             Requirements and Skills Needed:            Problem Solving   ability to identify key potential technical issues.  Roll up the sleeve when in need to troubleshoot and drive team to derive optimal solutions.         Excellent communication skills   ability to help translate business needs into IT deliverables.         Strong desire to learn a variety of business models and processes,  IT project governance and data analysis and willing to take up additional responsibilities.         Ability to build and evaluate business cases for operational improvements and understand how technology can be leveraged to accelerate operational improvements.         Willing to challenge requirements based on an understanding of prioritized objectives.  Demonstrate expertise in a variety of IT concepts,  practices,  and procedures.          Ability to work in a team environment delivering quality software that meets requirements working to a timeline.          Ability to work independently as well as in a team atmosphere.         Explore new business solutions and improvement opportunities to continually enhance the functionality that fulfills user needs.         Experience working directly with end-users,  vendors,  business,  and technical team members.         Be a self-starter and motivated person to be continually enhancing your skills to be aware of the latest software development trends/skills.         Ability and willingness to learn new programming languages,  frameworks,  and paradigms.         May provide consultation on complex projects.  A wide degree of creativity and latitude is expected.             Required skills and qualifications:            Bachelor s degree preferred in Computer Science/Information Technology with a minimum 4 years of experience.           Exposure to SAP & larger CRM application and integration.           Extensive experience in implementing high quality,  scalable and extendable . Net solutions using Azure,  ASP. NET,  C#. Net,  VB. net,  ASP. NET MVC,  JQuery,  Angular,  Backbone JS.         Experience using Azure DevOps pipeline and Git repositories.         Good hands-on experience in using Atlassian tools JIRA / Confluence / Azure Boards / Smartsheet.         Experience in REST API development,  SQL Server,  NoSQL database,  and RDBMS design and optimizations.         Experience with SaaS platforms and application Integration knowledge,  Cloud hosting,  ERP systems and Custom development solutions hosted on-premises or in the Cloud platform.          Experience in support,  maintenance,  and release management of the entire project management life cycle of applications.         Strong Microsoft Office skills,  especially in Excel and PowerPoint.  MS Project and Visio a plus as well.         Knowledge of basic algorithms,  object-oriented and functional design principles,  and best-practice patterns.         Understanding of typical web application life cycle,  SOA,  and micro-services patterns would be nice to have.

column2: The Connectivity team in Bangalore is an integral part of Global Connectivity organization which shall secure connected vehicles supporting the increasing demand for soft products      Connectivity is a key enabler for fleet management, uptime services and advanced vehicle services such as driver assistance, truck specific navigation and fuel reduction, targeting reduced costs as well as increased revenues      Connectivity develops software for telematics systems for several Volvo companies              At Test Automation & Verification Framework, our mission is to establish an integration and verification environment that enables continuous integration, thus reducing lead time-to-market and increasing product quality      The objective of this assignment is to implement and maintain ECU simulations      The engineer will join our global agile team to contribute with competence in CANoe simulation and Python based test automation      The main activities are to use CANoe as vehicle simulator and interface to our test framework              The position holder will report to Group Manager, Test Automation and Verification Framework, Connectivity                                ROLE DESCRIPTION                                Develop Simulations in canoe to simulate ECU behaviours in Test environment.                          Implement Diagnostics simulation solutions in CAPL for test framework.                          Integrating DB to existing simulations, Troubleshooting issues in DB.                          Writing modules in python for verification framework.                          Implementing wrapper interfaces in python for developing a scalable verification framework.                          Write automated test cases in Pytest/Capl.                          Knowledge in Jenkins, Pipeline for automation.                          Work in Scrum and Knowledge on SAFe release trains                                WHO ARE YOU?                                6-8 years of experience in automation of Embedded Software/Embedded systems/functions and/or component testing                        Good knowledge of ECU simulation in CANoe                        Automation experience using Python programming,(3.0/Higher) and CAPL scripting                          Knowledge of CAN (e.g. J1939) protocol and Canalyzer, CANOE.                          Automotive protocols CAN, Ethernet and preferred protocols like Bluetooth, Wifi etc                          Good understanding of GIT,JIRA ,Jenkins and Confluence                          CI/CD concepts                          Excellent communication and problem solving skills                          Systematic, analytic, pro-active and open minded with interest in software debugging                          BE/M.tech in Computer science, Electronics or Electrical Engineering, Computer science                          Basic knowledge in providing solutions for automation of verification activities in software within automotive domain                          Good design & analysis knowledge to perform the reviews with the development team                                      ARE WE THE PERFECT MATCH?                              In return we offer:                                  Professional challenges in the exciting field of connectivity and infotainment.                          A workplace where growth of our employees is in focus.                          A chance to make a difference in our path toward continuous development                          Challenging tasks with access to the latest tools and technology.                          We work together with energy, passion and respect for the individual!                          A great team which will make every day great

column2: Software Developers at IBM are the backbone of our strategic initiatives to design, code, test, and provide industry-leading solutions that make the world run today - planes and trains take off on time, bank transactions complete in the blink of an eye and the world remains safe because of the work our software developers do. Whether you are working on projects internally or for a client, software development is critical to the success of IBM and our clients worldwide. At IBM, you will use the latest software development tools, techniques and approaches and work with leading minds in the industry to build solutions you can be proud of Your Role and Responsibilities The position is for skilled test professionals to perform Hardware System test validation. They will perform system assurance tests and create test cases on scaled scenarios on different versions of the latest family of IBM Power servers utilizing several versions of PHYP, Power Firmware, AIX VIOS, and Linux releases.  Employees will be working closely with Development and Functional test organization in defining the test planning, scoping the valid scenarios for Line Items/Features. Employees will also work on troubleshooting and debugging customer field issues and incorporating test cases/updating existing test cases to further strengthen the test plan to maintain high product quality and customer satisfaction.  Teamwork is expected to be of the highest quality.  Required Technical and Professional Expertise 5+ years of experience in Install, configure, tuning and troubleshooting VIOS. 5+ years of experience in setting up and utilizing Live Partition Mobility.  Technical Leadership to drive the component test and report progress & issues in the mullitple IBM Power Systems Operating System Test experience- Kernel concepts and Internals (Process Management, Memory Management, Virtualization, Scheduling, Networking, Security etc.) Strong VIOS Administration skills (Install/Manage OS, Filesystems/LVM, AIX/Linux Commands, IO, PowerVM functionalities). IBM Power Systems exposure preferred Write and execute test cases with the ability to ensure proper coverage based on Line items/features requirements and workloads, and perform regression testing (Experience in EWM is a plus) Knowledge of end-to-end of Defect Management Knowledge of Agile and DevOps practices and methodologies including Continuous Integration (CI)/Continuous Deployment (CD)/Continuous Testing (CT) Ability to handle testing and debugging tasks independently Strong team player with good communication (verbal/written) and interpersonal skills C or Java Programming  Experience in Rational Quality Manager Experience in Linux adminstration Experience in IBM i administration Knowledge of Rational SDLC Tools (RTC, CQ) Knowledge of Big Data and Analytics Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise None

column1: Senior Software Quality Assurance Engineer - Mobile Applications
column2: Cerence Inc. is seeking a highly skilled Senior Quality Assurance Engineer to join our dynamic team focused on mobile applications. As a Senior QA Engineer, you will play a critical role in ensuring the quality and reliability of our mobile applications across various platforms. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, including software development, product management, and UX/UI design, to deliver high-quality mobile experiences to our users.             ?       Responsibilities:           Develop and execute comprehensive test plans and test cases for mobile applications, covering functional, performance, usability, and regression testing.         Collaborate with software developers to identify and prioritize test cases based on requirements and user stories.         Design, implement, and maintain automated test scripts and frameworks for mobile application testing.         Conduct manual testing as needed to validate the functionality and user experience of mobile applications.         Perform root cause analysis of defects and work with development teams to ensure timely resolution.         Continuously monitor and improve the quality assurance process to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.         Participate in Agile development processes, including sprint planning, daily stand-ups, and sprint reviews.         Provide mentorship and guidance to junior members of the QA team, sharing best practices and industry standards.         Stay updated on emerging trends and technologies in mobile application testing and quality assurance.               Who you are:           Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field. Master's degree preferred.         Proven experience (4+ years) in quality assurance for mobile applications, with a focus on iOS and Android platforms.         Strong understanding of software QA methodologies, tools, and processes.         Proficiency in writing clear, concise, and comprehensive test plans and test cases.         Hands-on experience with automated testing tools and frameworks such as Appium, XCTest, Espresso, or similar.         Solid programming skills in languages such as Java, Swift, Kotlin, or Python.         Experience with Agile development methodologies (Scrum, Kanban) and tools (JIRA, Confluence).         Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills, with a keen attention to detail.         Effective communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.         Certifications such as ISTQB Certified Tester, Agile Tester, or similar are a plus

column1: QA Profile with SQL and Service Testing
column2: Database Testing:SQL Knowledge: A QA professional in this role should be proficient in SQL (Structured Query Language) to create, execute, and validate database queries and scripts      They use SQL to retrieve and manipulate data in the database      Data Validation: Verify data integrity, accuracy, and consistency by comparing the data stored in the database with expected results      This involves performing data validation tests, data migration testing, and data transformation testing      Database Schema Testing: Ensure that the database schema (structure) is correctly designed and matches the application's requirements      Service Testing:API Testing: Conduct testing of application programming interfaces (APIs) to ensure they work as intended      This includes testing various API methods, input parameters, and response data      Web Services Testing: Test web services, including SOAP and RESTful services, to validate their functionality, security, and performance      Testers often use tools like Postman, SOAPUI, or similar tools      Integration Testing: Verify that different software components, including services, interact correctly and exchange data seamlessly      Load and Performance Testing: Assess the performance of services under different loads and usage scenarios to ensure they can handle traffic and requests efficiently      Test Case Design and Execution:Develop test cases, test scripts, and test scenarios specifically tailored for SQL and service testing      This includes both positive and negative test cases      Execute test cases and scripts to validate that database operations and services perform as expected      This may involve manual testing or automated testing, depending on the project's needs      Defect Reporting and Tracking:Identify and document defects or issues found during testing      Collaborate with development teams to resolve these issues and ensure proper tracking and resolution      Test Automation:Implement and maintain test automation frameworks and scripts for SQL and service testing when applicable      Automation helps ensure repeatability and efficiency in testing processes

column2: Participates in all steps of the software development life cycle and is accountable for producing quality code. Collaborates with peers to identify and recommend practices for quality assurance at the source using automation.              Conducts impact analysis, evaluates and identifies affects to regression test suites, testability of code, and application performance to reduce negative influences on continuous testing. Performs quality checks along with updating of automation scripts. Identifies and designs testing suites for test driven development (TDD) and behavior driven development (BDD) to allow early and frequent testing as the software is developed. Identifies process improvement and continuous quality measures across the development lifecycle.              Writes and executes application tests at the source code level to prevent hidden errors (i.e., white box testing) within unit and component testing.              Identifies and suggests improvements for code quality to improve deficiencies from functionality through structure of code for performance and maintainability.              Builds, maintains and reviews mid-level unit and component test suites and conducts automated white box tests.              Identifies improper coding and code quality issues. Integrates white box test suites with continuous integration (CI) tools. Programs and creates mid-level test cases using unit and component testing tools for code level testing.              Develops moderately complex software tools, frameworks and utilities for validation / verification activities and end-to-end functional testing of software.              Identifies and recommends tools and frameworks for testing and creates automated tools for generic use and maintainability.              Writes moderately complex code that uses / exercises non-user interface (UI) components like application program interfaces (APIs), representational state transfer API (RESTful API), and web services similar to the end user to develop frameworks for testing. Integrates automated suites with continuous integration (CI) tools for frequent execution.              Installs and uses moderately complex CI frameworks in continuous testing and continuous deployment / delivery.              Builds, customizes, and deploys moderately complex test environments and test automation frameworks.              Performs moderately complex scripting, data generation, and other methods to maintain automation infrastructure throughout the development. Integrates CI tools with other testing infrastructure and develops moderately complex reporting / metrics on CI.              Develops test scripts, test data, and analyzes / interprets performance, load and security testing.              Conducts testing, analysis and interprets results using service virtualization testing tools that emulates the behavior of necessary dependent system components that are unavailable or difficult-to-access.              Identifies virtualization testing opportunities with approaches and designs to testing virtualized environments.              Identifies performance testing opportunities with approaches and designs to test for application performance, load, security and service virtualization. Analyzes systems and database performance and responses during loads.              Direct tests to avoid common application performance bottlenecks.              Maintains and administers procedures, methodologies and/or application standards to include payment card industry and security related testing compliance using automation and built-in security tests during development.              Applies virtualization concepts to identify tests and application scenarios impacted by virtualization. Incorporates performance, load and security testing into CI environments.              Works with stakeholders, business, developers and test analysts to develop more intricate test plans, conditions and cases (set of inputs, execution preconditions, and expected outcomes developed for a particular objective, such as to exercise a particular program path or to verify compliance with a specific requirement) to be used in testing.              Develops and administers best practices to perform test data conditioning and execution of test sets.              Works with programming to create certain account conditions and execute special testing requirements for test validation.              Demonstrates a broad knowledge of the multiple environments by evaluating, interpreting and communicating an understanding of the various components of systems and applications to leadership.              Acts as a single point of contact for assigned moderately complex client projects with regard to test engineering activities.              Coordinates the test activities assigned to the test team to include, reviewing of client test plans cases and scripts, prioritizing test execution when necessary and providing feedback to internal and external clients.
column11: Automation, White box testing, Manager Quality Assurance, Test scripts, Testing tools, Coding, Functional testing, Performance testing, Test cases, Virtualization

column1: Automation Test Engineer - Software Testing Methodologies
column2: We are seeking a skilled Software Test Automation Engineer with hands-on experience in Python, BDD frameworks, and automating desktop-based applications. The ideal candidate should possess a strong background in software testing methodologies and automation processes. Responsibilities : - Develop and implement automated test scripts for desktop-based applications using Python. - Utilize Behavior-Driven Development (BDD) frameworks to create efficient and maintainable test scenarios. - Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand testing requirements and automate test cases accordingly. - Execute automated test suites, analyze results, and report findings to stakeholders. - Enhance existing automation frameworks and tools to improve test coverage and efficiency. - Debug issues and collaborate with developers to resolve software defects. - Provide expertise in test automation best practices and contribute to the continuous improvement of the automation process. Requirements : - Hands-on experience in Python programming language for test automation. - Proficiency in implementing BDD frameworks like Behave, pytest-bdd, or similar. - Strong understanding of software test automation processes and methodologies. - Ability to develop, maintain, and execute automated test scripts. - Experience in automating desktop-based applications is highly desirable. - Familiarity with tools such as Test Complete for desktop application automation is a plus. - Solid debugging skills and attention to detail. - Excellent communication and collaboration skills. - Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field (or equivalent work experience). Preferred Qualifications : - Previous experience with Test Complete or similar tools for desktop application automation. - Knowledge of continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines. - Familiarity with Agile development methodologies. Benefits : - Competitive salary and benefits package. - Opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies in a dynamic environment. - Professional development and training opportunities. - Flexible work schedule and remote work options. If you meet the above qualifications and are passionate about automation testing and software quality assurance, we encourage you to apply and join our innovative team!

column2: Sitero is currently seeking a knowledgeable PowerShell Automation Specialist to join our team. As a PowerShell Automation Specialist, your primary responsibility will be to design, develop, and deploy PowerShell scripts to facilitate seamless updates and configurations across our user computer ecosystem. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in PowerShell scripting and a solid understanding of Microsoft Intune and AutoPilot for streamlined deployment.                 The ideal candidate will possess excellent communication skills, a high level of ambition, and a strong desire to learn and grow. This position will involve managing various projects, running reports, implementing security measures, and handling system rollouts to end-users, including cyber security training, autopilot and intune configurations, patching vulnerabilities, and developing scripts for automated reporting and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs).                      ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES                   Develop and maintain PowerShell scripts to automate various tasks, including software updates, security patches, and system configurations.              Collaborate with the IT team to identify areas for automation and improvement, aligning script development with business needs and objectives.              Implement and maintain an automated deployment system using Microsoft Intune and AutoPilot for efficient and consistent rollouts across the organization.             Troubleshoot and debug scripts, addressing any issues or errors that may arise during the deployment process.              Generate and analyze reports on system performance, security incidents, and other relevant metrics, providing insights and recommendations for improvement.             Manage system rollouts to end-users, including conducting cyber security training sessions, configuring autopilot and intune settings, and patching vulnerabilities on user devices.             Monitor script performance and optimize code to ensure reliable and efficient execution.             Develop and maintain scripts for automated reporting and KPI tracking, providing accurate and timely information to stakeholders.             Stay updated on emerging technologies, industry trends, and best practices, actively seeking opportunities to enhance skills and knowledge.             Assist with troubleshooting and resolving system-related issues, working closely with technical support teams and vendors when necessary.             Provide timely and effective communication to stakeholders, ensuring clear and concise documentation of system configurations, procedures, and incidents.                       EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE REQUIRED                   BE/BTech in Computer Science or equivalent             Minimum 5 Years of experience             Proven experience working as an automation specialist, with a focus on Azure or AWS cloud platforms and Windows systems.             Strong working knowledge of PowerShell scripting, with the ability to automate tasks and develop basic tools.             Familiarity with cyber security principles and best practices, including user training, device configurations, and vulnerability patching.             Experience with autopilot and Intune configurations for managing end-user devices is a plus.             Knowledge of reporting and analytics tools to generate insights and track Key Performance Indicators (KPIs).             Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to effectively communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.             High ambition and a strong desire to learn and grow in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.             Strong problem-solving skills, with the ability to analyze and resolve system-related issues in a timely manner.             Detail-oriented mindset with the ability to multitask and prioritize tasks effectively.             Proactive attitude towards identifying and implementing process improvements.             Experience managing leading life sciences system implementations would be an advantage (i.e. CTMS, Drug Safety, EDC, Quality, CRM, Data Analytics, HRMS, Accounting / Finance, etc.),                    COMPENSATION & BENEFITS           Sitero proudly offers an impressive compensation package and benefits, including a competitive salary, Variable pay, paid time off, and healthcare and retirement benefits.

Must have skills : Automated Testing Good to have skills : Test Automation Strategy Minimum  5  year(s) of experience is required Educational Qualification : Graduation Summary :As a Test Automation Lead, you will be responsible for leading the transformation of testing into a continuous and efficient end-to-end quality engineering function through the use of quality processes, tools, and methodologies. Your typical day will involve developing and implementing automated testing strategies, leading a team of testers, and ensuring the accuracy and integrity of testing processes.  Roles & Responsibilities: Develop and implement automated testing strategies, including designing and executing automated test scripts and ensuring the accuracy and integrity of testing processes. Lead a team of testers, providing guidance and support to ensure the successful delivery of testing projects. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and resolve testing issues, ensuring the timely delivery of high-quality software products. Evolve more predictive and intelligent testing approaches based on automation and innovative testing products and solutions, staying up-to-date with the latest advancements in testing technologies and methodologies. Professional & Technical Skills: Must To Have Skills:Strong experience in Automated Testing. Good To Have Skills:Experience in Test Automation Strategy. Experience in leading a team of testers, providing guidance and support to ensure the successful delivery of testing projects. Experience in collaborating with cross-functional teams to identify and resolve testing issues, ensuring the timely delivery of high-quality software products. Strong understanding of testing methodologies and technologies, including experience with automated testing tools and frameworks. Solid grasp of software development life cycle (SDLC) and agile methodologies. Additional Information: The candidate should have a minimum of 5 years of experience in Automated Testing. The ideal candidate will possess a strong educational background in computer science or a related field, along with a proven track record of delivering high-quality testing solutions. This position is based at our Mumbai office. Qualification Graduation

column2: Responsibilities A day in the life of an Infoscion As part of the Infosys consulting team, your primary role would be to actively aid the consulting team in different phases of the project including problem definition, effort estimation, diagnosis, solution generation and design and deployment  You will explore the alternatives to the recommended solutions based on research that includes literature surveys, information available in public domains, vendor evaluation information, etc. and build POCs  You will create requirement specifications from the business needs, define the to-be-processes and detailed functional designs based on requirements. You will support configuring solution requirements on the products; understand if any issues, diagnose the root-cause of such issues, seek clarifications, and then identify and shortlist solution alternatives You will also contribute to unit-level and organizational initiatives with an objective of providing high quality value adding solutions to customers. If you think you fit right in to help our clients navigate their next in their digital transformation journey, this is the place for you!A day in the life of an Infoscion As part of the Infosys testing team, your primary role would be to anchor testing requirements, develop test strategy, track & monitor project plans, review test plans, test cases and test scripts.  You will develop project quality plans, validate defective prevention plans to deliver effective testing solutions for clients. You will ensure right test environment is available and provide necessary review feedback for test data setup to ensure timely commencement of test execution You will validate "go live" activities such as production verification to ensure that the application runs in the production environment without any issues. In addition, you will mentor the team and provide regular feedback and coaching to help them continually improve their performance If you think you fit right in to help our clients navigate their next in their digital transformation journey, this is the place for you! column2: About this Opportunity The Senior Infrastructure Test Analyst works in a rapid development environment as a part of multi-disciplinary team of engineers that designs, develops, evaluates, test, verifies, validates, and provides in-service engineering support for the Infrastructure Test Engineering team. Experience inPython/Ruby/Shell script (any one is fine), Cloud, Jenkins as well as configuration management tools (e.g., Chef or Ansible), he/she should be able to write and support automated testing solutions for multi-tiered applications.This position requires the ability to write automated testing solutions using tools such as: Chef-InSpec, shell scripts/Python/Ruby, Jenkins and use of monitoring tools. Requires in-depth knowledge of the software implementation lifecycle and the ability to work well with both business clients and developers. Your Responsibilities: Design and develop test cases using traditional test design techniques based on Stories/Epics or functional requirements Understand the Infrastructure from design document in order to identify the scope of required testing and implementing automation and integration into Jenkins CI/CD pipelines. Performing manual testing of UI or APIs or any application that requires manual testing. develop, maintain and execute automated test scripts using Python/Ruby/Shell Script with Jenkins. Support overall QA activities such as development of Test Approach, Test Cases, and manual test execution as needed. Works closely with application development and other technical teams to understand how changes in the software product affect maintenance of test scripts. Work with project stakeholders during project definition to help the team understand risks, dependencies, and opportunities; participate in requirements definition and review; lend subject matter expertise to projects. Ensure on-time delivery of work including monitoring of external and internal dependencies, tracking of progress, and monitoring of project milestones. Support the adoption of the Delivery Pipeline Develop a basic understanding of the product being delivered Build understanding of DTCC infrastructure principles and best practices Works with the team to review deliverables and ensure quality and accuracy; Adheres to established rules and procedures when performing work. Align risk and control processes into day to day responsibilities to monitor and mitigate risk; escalates appropriately Sound Like You? Minimum of 2 years of related experience Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience Additional Qualifications Hands on experience in automation scripting using Python/Ruby/Perl/Bash (any one is fine) Knowledge of Configuration Management Tools Ansible/Chef/Puppet (any one is fine) Knowledge of Jenkins (CI/CD) Pipelines. Basic Knowledge of Linux OS or any UNIX flavored OS working knowledge Capable of working on multiple work streams concurrently in a fast-paced environment with extreme multi-tasking and context switching. Experience with stories and defect Tracking in JIRA. Manual testing using Postman or executions of APIs using Python, or any automation would be good.

column2: Role Description As a Quality and Testing Engineer you will closely work together with business and operation units and bring functional testing, test management and test automation skills to enforce the development team within a Squad. You will extensively make use and apply test automation concepts and practices in the context of Deutsche Banks digitalization journey. Key Roles & Responsibilities You are involved in the Software Development Lifecycle starting from analyzing requirements, maintaining test cases, developing test automation features and testing software - continuously improving these topics. Develop/ support test automation strategy for large complex projects in AGILE methodology. Develop support non-functional testing automation strategy for large complex projects in AGILE methodology. Contribute to team agile planning activities and backlog prioritization and management. Collaborates with product line stakeholders to understand and develop strategies, frameworks relating to their emerging demands. Driving innovation/adoption of Industry practices through investigation/institutionalization of new tools/methods/standards. Ensures that testing activities are being conducted in accordance with the testing strategy and plan. Perform and achieve in sprint testing team and release goals. Create test documents like: Test Plan, Test Risk Assessments, and Test Results and make sure that they are reviewed and approved by appropriate stakeholders. Participate in estimation of User Stories in Story points. Create, Automate and Execute test cases to cover all user stories acceptance criteria and honor timely deliveries. Increase the test coverage and test speed by automating all possible test cases. Create and develop test automation frameworks. Integrate test automation framework into CI/CD pipeline. Ensure test flakiness is at a minimum. Participate and help in knowledge transfer sessions when necessary. Defects submission, monitoring, and retesting Keep demo sessions to prove acceptance criteria are met. Coordinate the preparation of test environments. Define and create all test data test data generators needed for the tests. Maintain regression test pack. Align with dev team to understand the integration with different systems to execute System Integration Testing Provide regular status reporting to scrum team. Verify entry/exit criteria for all SIT, UAT phases. You actively participate and contribute into the sprint activities and ceremonies e.g. daily stand-up, Sprint planning, retrospectives, refinements etc. You collaborate with other team members to achieve the sprint objectives Your Skills and Experience: Strong experience in  requirements analysis for test case creation and test execution of user stories  using tools like Quality Centre/ALM, Confluence , Jira ,SOAP UI, Filetransfer, SQL developer, Strong experience in  development of Test Automation features using UFT  (unified functional testing)  and / or Selenium  with Java. Experience in  automation of mainframe applications  interested in automating mainframe applications. Experience in  API testing  is a must. Experience in Postman is an additional benefit. Open for manual testing for at least a year in parallel to identifying automation candidates. Individual contributor with an attitude to learn and deliver. Pro-active team player  with  good communication  skills as well as good  English  language skills. Experience with  Agile/SCRUM  environment including agile tooling and methodology together with Knowledge of investment business and its operations.

column1: QA Automation Consultant - GitHub, TOSCA & SFDC
column2: We are seeking a talented QA Automation Engineer with extensive experience in GitHub, TOSCA, and Salesforce to join our team.      The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining automated testing frameworks and scripts to ensure the quality and reliability of software    applications, with a focus on Salesforce-based solutions.      This role requires    strong technical expertise, excellent communication skills, and the ability to    work effectively in a collaborative environment.     Key Responsibilities:     Test Automation Development: Design, develop, and maintain    automated test scripts using industry-standard tools and frameworks, with a    focus on GitHub, TOSCA, and Salesforce technologies.     Test Planning and Strategy: Collaborate with cross-functional teams    to develop comprehensive test plans, strategies, and test cases to validate    software functionality, performance, and security.     Tool Evaluation and Implementation: Evaluate testing tools and    technologies, recommend best practices, and implement automated testing    solutions tailored to the needs of the project, leveraging GitHub, TOSCA, and    Salesforce capabilities.     Continuous Integration and Deployment: Integrate automated tests    into the continuous integration and deployment pipelines using tools like    Jenkins, GitLab CI/CD, or similar platforms, ensuring timely and efficient    testing of software releases.     Defect Management: Identify, document, and track software defects    using issue tracking systems like Jira or similar tools, working closely with    development teams to prioritize and resolve issues.     Test Environment Setup and Configuration: Set up and configure test    environments, including Salesforce sandboxes or other relevant systems, to    replicate production environments and facilitate automated testing.     Regression Testing: Execute automated regression tests to validate    the impact of code changes and ensure the stability of existing functionality    across different Salesforce modules and integrations.     Performance Testing: Develop and execute performance tests to    assess the scalability and responsiveness of Salesforce applications,    identifying bottlenecks and optimizing system performance.     Documentation and Reporting: Create and maintain documentation for    test scripts, test results, and automation frameworks, and generate reports to    communicate test findings and metrics to stakeholders.     Training and Knowledge Sharing: Provide training and guidance to    team members on automated testing best practices, tools, and techniques,    fostering a culture of quality and continuous improvement.     Qualifications:     Proven experience as a QA Automation Engineer, Consultant, or    similar role, with a focus on Salesforce testing.     Strong proficiency in test automation tools and frameworks, with    expertise in GitHub, TOSCA, and Salesforce automation.     Hands-on experience with Salesforce development, configuration, and    customization.     Solid understanding of software testing principles, methodologies,    and practices.     Experience with version control systems like Git and collaboration    platforms like GitHub.     Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen    attention to detail.     Effective communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability    to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.     Salesforce certifications (e.g., Salesforce Administrator,    Salesforce Developer) are a plus.     Familiarity with agile development methodologies and continuous    integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) practices.     Preferred Skills:     Experience with other automated testing tools and technologies,    such as Selenium, Cypress, or Protractor.     Knowledge of scripting languages like JavaScript, Python, or Apex.     Understanding of Salesforce Lightning Web Components (LWC) and Aura    framework.     Experience with API testing and integration testing.     Knowledge of DevOps practices and tools for automation and    infrastructure as code (IaC).     Certification in software testing (e.g., ISTQB) or Salesforce    certifications related to testing and automation.

column2: A Performance Tester is responsible for evaluating the performance and stability of software systems. This includes designing, executing and analyzing performance tests, identifying performance bottlenecks and providing recommendations for improvement. The key responsibilities for this role include:     Developing and executing performance testing plans, scenarios, scripts, and procedures.     Monitoring and analyzing performance metrics such as response time, resource utilization, and errors.     Identifying performance bottlenecks and recommending solutions to improve performance.     Collaborating with development teams to ensure performance requirements are met.     Keeping up-to-date with new testing tools and techniques to enhance testing processes.     Documenting test results, creating reports and presenting findings to stakeholders.     Establishing and maintaining performance testing standards and procedures.The ideal candidate should have experience with performance testing methodologies and tools, as well as a strong understanding of software development and system architecture. Strong problem-solving, communication and analytical skills are also essential for this role.

column2: Responsibilities :  Automated Testing : Develop and implement automated test scripts using Java, Selenium, and API testing tools to ensure the robustness and reliability of our software products. Test Planning : Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand project requirements, create comprehensive test plans, and contribute to the overall testing strategy. Test Execution : Execute automated test scripts, analyze results, and report on the status of test coverage, identifying and documenting defects and issues. API Testing : Conduct thorough API testing to ensure the seamless integration and functionality of various software components. Continuous Improvement : Proactively identify areas for improvement in the testing process and contribute to enhancing the overall efficiency and effectiveness of the quality assurance practices. Collaboration : Work closely with developers, product managers, and other stakeholders to address quality-related concerns and promote a culture of quality throughout the software development life cycle. Documentation : Maintain clear and concise documentation of test cases, test scripts, and testing processes. Regression Testing : Conduct regression testing to ensure that new features or enhancements do not negatively impact existing functionality. Qualifications :  - Bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, Engineering, or a related field. - 5-8 years of hands-on experience in automated testing, with a strong focus on Java, Selenium, and API testing. - Proven experience in developing and executing automated test scripts for web applications. - Solid understanding of software development life cycle, testing methodologies, and best practices. - Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with meticulous attention to detail. - Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional team environment. - Experience with hybrid working arrangements, showing the ability to manage responsibilities effectively in remote and office settings. - Familiarity with Agile/Scrum methodologies is a plus.

Role Details        The QA Analyst will be a core member on the Apple team and will be responsible for:      Maintain a high-quality standard product by creating comprehensive test suites for all Apple      platforms and providing accurate test estimates for our development team.      Execute manual functional test runs throughout feature development      Effectively communicate test results to our engineers and product managers through proper      communication pipelines.      Critically think about the level and complexity of testing required in each stage of the software      development life cycle. column2: Responsible for ensuring the accuracy, completeness, and efficiency of the ETL process used to transfer data from one system to another.        The primary duties of an ETL Test Engineer may include:         Developing ETL test cases and test plans that ensure data quality, accuracy, and completeness.     Conducting functional and non-functional testing of ETL processes to validate the integrity of the data being transferred.     Identifying and documenting defects, issues, and potential improvements in the ETL process and sharing them with the development team.     Creating and maintaining ETL test environments that simulate production environments for testing purposes.     Conducting load testing to measure the scalability and performance of ETL processes under different workloads.     Conducting regression testing to ensure that changes made to ETL processes do not introduce new defects or issues.     Developing and maintaining test automation scripts to improve the efficiency of ETL testing.     To perform the role of an ETL Test Engineer effectively, candidates should possess strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills, as well as experience with ETL testing tools and technologies, such as SQL, ETL testing frameworks, and test automation tools.

column2: Skills  : - Sr RPA Tester Job Description : - 7+ years Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned as appropriate. Work closely with the development team to understand RPA requirements and design test cases accordingly. Develop and execute comprehensive test plans test cases and test scripts for UiPath RPA workflows. Perform functional integration system and regression testing of RPA solutions. Participate in the review and refinement of user stories and acceptance criteria. Contribute to the continuous improvement of testing processes and methodologies. Stay updated with the latest trends and best practices in RPA testing and automation. Help the team add UiPath Test Suite to their automation portfolio. Act as the UiPath SME and teach the rest of the team on how to use UiPath Test Suite and define best practices - specifically providing suggestions around structuring projects use of labels and building a framework and/or modular components. Create automated test cases in UiPath Studio and publish them to UiPath Orchestrator as well as use UiPath Test Manager to manage assets related to automation testing. Analysing test execution results Create manage and run Test Sets using UiPath Orchestrator and UiPath Test Robots Qualifications To perform this job successfully an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge skill and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  Required Skills: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science Information Technology or a related field. A Master's degree may be preferred in some cases. Proven experience (typically 7+ years) as a UiPath Developer or RPA Developer with a focus on UiPath technology.  Proven experience as an RPA Tester specifically with UiPath. Hands-on experience with UiPath Studio Test Suite Orchestrator and other related tools. Proficiency in creating and executing test cases test scripts and test plans. Experience with functional integration system and regression testing. Solid understanding of software testing methodologies and best practices. UiPath Certified Advanced RPA Developer (UiARD) certification required. Strong proficiency in designing and implementing end-to-end automation solutions using UiPath Studio and Orchestrator. Excellent understanding of RPA concepts methodologies and best practices. Solid knowledge of process mapping workflow design and process optimization. Experience working with Document Understanding AI Center Action Center UiPath Studio Orchestrator and UiPath Apps Experience building custom rules for the workflow analyzer. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills to identify automation opportunities and troubleshoot issues. Strong communication skills to interact with both technical and non-technical stakeholders effectively. Knowledge of Agile/Scrum methodologies and experience working in Agile environments is a plus. Other Skills and Abilities: Excellent time management decision making prioritization and organization skills. Proven technical aptitude and proven customer service aptitude.

column2: We are looking for talented individuals with the skills and vision to build a better tomorrow by safety compliance for emerging verticals of renewable energy like PV inverters, Battery storages and more     Join our R&D team, develop your skills on the job and work at the state-of-the-art products impacting entire cities, countries -craft the things to come         This is your role. What part will you play         You should have core knowledge of grid and safety compliance / test automation / Certification.         Tasks/ Responsibilities             Creation of specifications for the inverters from the guidelines of the grid operators and the respective applicable international standards.          Support in the design of control algorithms to meet the grid operator requirements.         Participation in the creation and finalization of requirements and functional Specifications.          Preliminary measurement for certification with test set-up and measurement procedure?conforming to standards (focus on safety requirements and grid coupling).          Supervision of measurement institutes or certifiers during in-house measurements or, if necessary, in external laboratories.          Execution of measurements and reporting for self-declarations.          Preparation of risk analysis with focus on device safety in coordination with development departments.          Clarification of problems with hardware and software team.          Creation of inverter models relevant for certification (e.g. PowerFactory and/or PSSE, PSCAD).          Participation in standardization committees for a better and earlier understanding of the requirements.          Supervision of research projects in the field of grid integration of PV plants.          Further development of test automation.          Supporting other departments with technical questions.          Communication with international development team.         Expertise              Completed studies (BE/B.Tech/M.Tech) in electrical engineering/energy systems or a comparable education          Professional experience, preferably in the area of grid and safety compliance / test automation / certification or a comparable area.          Very good knowledge in the use of MATLAB & Simulink as well as in one of the following simulation programs - PowerFactory, PSCAD or PSSE advantageous.          Programming experience in Python or similar to support test analysis and automation an advantage.          Experience in the field of grid integration of generation units/plants advantageous.          Knowledge in the field of (photovoltaic) inverters and/or storage advantageous          Knowledge of standards for (photovoltaic) inverters and their environment advantageous.          Routine in the operation of laboratory equipment and control software (AC/DC sources/sinks, measuring devices and LabVIEW) advantageous.          Knowledge of power electronics advantageous.          Good communication skill.          Personal and Social Skills             Structured and independent way of working.          Openness, ability to work in a team.          High degree of independence and result orientation.          High level of commitment and flexibility.          Good English language skills mandatory.      Interfaces          Interfaces to all other specialist departments in development.          Interfaces to production, service, quality and purchasing.          Technical contact for component manufacturers and suppliers as well as external certification and measurement institutes.

column2: Responsibilities A day in the life of an Infoscion As part of the Infosys consulting team, your primary role would be to actively aid the consulting team in different phases of the project including problem definition, effort estimation, diagnosis, solution generation and design and deployment  You will explore the alternatives to the recommended solutions based on research that includes literature surveys, information available in public domains, vendor evaluation information, etc. and build POCs  You will create requirement specifications from the business needs, define the to-be-processes and detailed functional designs based on requirements.  You will support configuring solution requirements on the products; understand if any issues, diagnose the root-cause of such issues, seek clarifications, and then identify and shortlist solution alternatives  You will also contribute to unit-level and organizational initiatives with an objective of providing high quality value adding solutions to customers. If you think you fit right in to help our clients navigate their next in their digital transformation journey, this is the place for you!A day in the life of an Infoscion As part of the Infosys testing team, your primary role would be to anchor testing requirements, develop test strategy, track & monitor project plans, review test plans, test cases and test scripts.  You will develop project quality plans, validate defective prevention plans to deliver effective testing solutions for clients.  You will ensure right test environment is available and provide necessary review feedback for test data setup to ensure timely commencement of test execution  You will validate "go live" activities such as production verification to ensure that the application runs in the production environment without any issues.  In addition, you will mentor the team and provide regular feedback and coaching to help them continually improve their performance If you think you fit right in to help our clients navigate their next in their digital transformation journey, this is the place for you!
