column1: Quality Engineer (Cypress) - Senior Associate 2- P&T Labs
column2: A career in Products and Technology is an opportunity to bring PwCs strategy to life by driving products and technology into everything we deliver      Our clients expect us to bring the right people and the right technology to solve their biggest problems; Products and Technology is here to help PwC meet that challenge and accelerate the growth of our business      We have skilled technologists, data scientists, product managers and business strategists who are using technology to accelerate change      Our team collaborates with product strategy and product managers to govern readiness standards in achieving principles (compliance, privacy, security) by design for what PwC s technology assets require to be successful in the market      They provide guidance for product development across the lifecycle (ideation / strategy through commercialization / monetization)      Additionally, they facilitate market readiness for technology assets overall, as changes occur to assets or market conditions throughout the asset s life cycle            As a Senior Associate, you ll work as part of a team of problem solvers with extensive consulting and industry experience, helping our clients solve their complex business issues from strategy to execution. Specific responsibilities include but are not limited to:              Design and develop automated tests for new business critical flows              Maintain existing automated tests              Enhance automation framework to meet ongoing demand and new tools and technology.              Establish effective working relationships directly with internal product development teams              Contribute to the development of your own and team s technical acumen              Collaborate with other product teams; sharing QA automation best practices and testing frameworks to promote standardization across the firm.              Able to communicate effectively across multiple workstream leads, geographies, and product management;              Thorough Understanding of modern software development processes including development process lifecycle, Agile development methodologies, etc; Continue to develop internal relationships and your PwC brand                  Minimum Degree Required:          Bachelor s Degree in information technology or Computer Science                    QA Automation engineer will have complete ownership for preparing test automation solutions, designing automation frameworks and implementation of test strategy, test plans test execution of the product              Design and create test conditions, test data to address business and technical use cases              Use existing tools and techniques to execute test cases and build/script new tools for performing testing/validation function              Develop and lead the automation strategy/effort and generate scripts to perform automated testing cycles using Robot Selenium or Cypress              Design, Execute and analyze automation test scripts test results for Web applications              Supports automation script development and the optimization of those scripts.              Create a standard framework for Functional Automation. Presents technical documentation for review by peers and the Development community.              To work individually or with the QA team for resolution of technical issues of the product as needed.              Develop automation strategy to support regression testing based on the technical analysis, complexity and reusability              Responds appropriately and competently to the demands of work challenges when confronted with changes, ambiguity, adversity, and other pressures.            REQUIRED SKILLS:        Responsible for testing features to ensure adherence to requirements as specified by the BA in the work items      Independently executes and maintains an automated QA regression suite      Actively participate in both technical and functional discussions relative to ongoing and future user story development      Provide input to the development of project initiation documents including objectives, scope, approach and deliverables, when needed      Establish strong working relationships with the development team, business, operations and other IT team members      Participate in and support cross-team process improvement initiatives      Assist in the creation and maintenance of application guidelines, standards, policies and procedures and disseminate to IT teams      5+ years of experience in QA automation      BS Computer Science, BS Information Systems or equivalent experience      Understanding of relevant information system technologies and the agile software development life cycle; including planning, execution and review      Strong organization and communication skills with the ability to concisely articulate status, issues and risks      Experience creating and maintaining test suites within Azure DevOps      Hands-on development experience with QA automation frameworks; preferably using Selenium and SpecFlow      Working knowledge of CI/CD pipelines, C#, JavaScript, REST APIs, jquery, LINQ query, SQL and dot net

column2: Job Description: We are looking for a skilled and motivated QA Engineer with strong software testing fundamentals and a proven track record of maintaining consistency in QA processes. The ideal candidate should have a deep understanding of SDLC lifecycle and agile methodology, along with hands-on experience in automation using Python, Robot Framework, and Selenium. Participate in agile ceremonies such as sprint planning, stand-ups, and retrospectives. Ensure adherence to QA best practices and standards throughout the development lifecycle. Perform regression testing and identify defects to ensure timely resolution. Integrate testing processes with GIT and Jenkins for continuous integration and deployment. Document test cases, test results, and defects in a clear and organized manner. Stay updated with industry trends and technologies related to QA and automation. Qualifications and Skills: Bachelor's engineering degree  in Computer Science or a related field. 1 to 2 years of experience in a QA role, with a strong focus on software testing fundamentals. Proficiency in automation testing using Python, Robot Framework, and Selenium. Experience with GIT for version control and Jenkins for continuous integration. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Excellent communication and collaboration abilities. Ability to work independently and in a team-oriented environment.

Delivery of DSM functionality will transform customer experience by providing omni-channel capability, quality of information, real-time interactions with the bank, self-servicing, deliver optimised business processes, APIs linking to back-end systems, robotics, and machine learning to facilitate improvements in processes. The programme will transform the way clients and internal users interact with each other by delivering automation, reducing client onboarding and service turnaround times, all with the aim of protecting and growing the business. The DSM programme team are looking to hire Business Functional Analysts to join the Pune development team. The Business Functional Analyst will be responsible for business solution design as a whole in complex project environments and translating requirements into specific functional specifications for solution development and implementation. The lead manages delivery of other members of the team and assigns their work where applicable. Your key responsibilities  As a Lead Business Functional Analyst, you will be responsible to lead the end-to-end communication for design and implementation of ongoing deliveries and critical future enhancements related to Client facing case management payment search application, ISO KD, Cash Inquiry Edit flows, SWIFT Integration, SRO React re-platforming, MIS report development, integration projects and new enhancements, as defined by use cases defined by both internal and external stakeholders. You will closely work with Domain Architect, Solution Architect, Product Owners & Development Team to understand their needs from a technical perspective. Work closely with business stakeholders to convert high-level requirements to user stories having well defined acceptance criteria. Provide capable end to end solutions by taking complete ownership. Participate in the end-to-end product life cycle, including requirements gathering, solution design, and testing. Supports in designing solution architectures for a business domain area or project which align with the overall bank-wide data architecture. Ensures that design of solutions conform to the defined principles, blueprints, standards, patterns, etc. Undertaking peer reviews of, and creating solution architectures and designs, taking into consideration specific business and technical constraints, requirements, and dependencies. Mentoring colleagues on adapting technologies, supporting in tricky situations, and encouraging to learn. Be a mentor and role-model for other members in the team and be proactive in providing performance feedback to your team members. Your skills and experience Must be an expert analyst with a passion for good architecture and design. Ability to communicate complex ideas simply and effectively with concise written artefacts. Teamwork and communication skills are essential. Passion for quality and continuous improvement of processes and software. Experience with Agile software development methodologies. Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and create a positive working atmosphere. Passion for sharing knowledge and best practices, and promote collaboration, in virtual/ matrix teams. Must have experience driving a team towards end-to-end solution. Candidates with experience of working with payment domain will be preferred.
column10: Investment Banking / Venture Capital / Private Equity
column11: Agile software development, SWIFT Integration, solution design, customer service, software development methodologies

Knowledge of Agile software development life-cycle methodologies  Experience of working with multi-cultural and geographically disparate teams  Familiarity with the Mutual Funds and Investment Management industry  Ability to understand functional specifications from the customer perspective and design appropriate acceptance tests  Proven experience of driving automation for functional and non-functional testing.  Ability to create and implement Performance automation frameworks in order to enable agile delivery.  Managing end-to-end performance engagements in vendor driven projects/engagements along with providing overall strategy, engagement, governance etc.  Understanding of multi-tiered architecture and good exposure to test home grown applications along with third party products in on premise applications, SaaS and cloud based implementation Ability to communicate clearly and effectively with different levels of stakeholders in application delivery, QA and business groups  Ability to transform organisation / testing teams from Manual to Automated / Semi automated mode  Thorough understanding of test principles such as unit, smoke, functional (black box/white box), user acceptance and usability testing  Good knowledge of prevailing trends in testing domain for agile deliveries  Experience of establishing agile practices in QA teams and reduce testing time for accelerated product verification  Ability to analyse defects, spot trends and suggest corrective actions for early detection Experience of working in tight deadlines in a matured, risk-based and ??ime-boxed??testing environment  Be able to demonstrate consistent and good judgement of assessing severity of issues Experience in stress, load and performance testing of global and regional applications with ability to define and document performance testing requirements and scenarios.   Desirable Skills   ISEB/ISTQB certification or equivalent Exposure to testing mobile applications / apps Exposure to a varied environments and products like:   J2EE technologies and the WebSphere family of products  Web Services, SOAP, XML messaging etc.  Personal Characteristics   Excellent interpersonal and communication skills   Proven experience of liaison with stakeholders in international locations  Excellent documentation skills Initiative in keeping abreast of changing industry practices, testing framework and methodologies, test tools  Self-motivation is essential, should demonstrate commitment to high quality design and development and passion for testing Ability to develop & maintain working relationships with a number of stakeholders and senior professionals  Flexibility and an open attitude towards change Problem solving skills with the ability to think laterally, and to think with a medium to long term perspective  Ability to learn and quickly get familiar with a complex business and systems environment  Willingness to travel overseas at a short-notice  Willingness to work in different time-zones as required

column2: Carry out procedures to ensure that all applications under test (AUT) meet organizational standards and end-user requirements      Thoroughly test software to ensure proper operation and freedom from defects      Document and work to identify all problems to ensure resolution      Report progress on testing and problem resolution to appropriate parties      Devise improvements to current procedures and develops models of possible future configurations      Perform work flow analysis and recommends quality improvements              What Part Will You Play?          Conducts online, batch and data verification testing (checked for accuracy and inconsistencies after data migration is done) and validates test results. Creates test designs and performs test analysis on complex project requirements (as defined by the client). Coordinates with technical and business resources to identify and resolve complex issues or system defects discovered during the testing and design contingency plans as needed.      Analyzes requirements necessary to design complex testing strategies (testing objective, methods of testing new functions, total time and resources required for the project, and the testing environment) for internal/external clients (i.e. technical and functional designs). Demonstrates extensive knowledge and understanding of structured analysis and design (define user needs) as it relates to the test design. Recognizes the interrelationships between the various functional components of the system (i.e. collections, posting, authorizations) and the business, technical and project requirements in order to determine the appropriate testing methodology to use during test execution and validation. Performs risk analysis requirements for integrated testing (combined and tested as a group).      Identifies and recommends design processes aimed at increased efficiency, performance and reliability (automation, load and performance). Demonstrates a strong working knowledge of automated testing tools used to create test designs and execute test plans.      Works with stakeholders, business, developers and test analysts to develop more intricate test plans, conditions and cases (set of inputs, execution preconditions, and expected outcomes developed for a particular objective, such as to exercise a particular program path or to verify compliance with a specific requirement) to be used in testing. Develops and administers best practices to perform test data conditioning and execution of test sets. Works with programming to create certain account conditions and execute special testing requirements for test validation. Demonstrates a broad knowledge of the multiple environments by evaluating, interpreting and communicating an understanding of the various components of systems and applications to leadership.      Compiles, develops and documents test/defect reports and follows all defects through to resolution and closure. Occasionally reviews documentation such as business and technical specifications in order to ensure that the documentation is updated and accurate.      Maintains and administers procedures, methodology and/or application standards to include payment card industry and security related compliance according to how they are applied in testing activities.      Acts as a single point of contact for assigned moderately complex client projects with regard to test activities. Demonstrates a working knowledge of the use of automated testing tools and executes manual and automated tests.              Works with stakeholders, business, developers and test analysts to develop test plans, conditions and cases (set of inputs, execution preconditions, and expected outcomes developed for a particular objective, such as to exercise a particular program path or to verify compliance with a specific requirement) to be used in testing, and performs test data conditioning and execution of test sets. Works with programming to condition accounts and execute special testing requirements for test validation.              Demonstrates a base knowledge of using multiple environments to validate test conditions and review data values by explaining the various components of systems and applications to leadership.              Documents test results and creates detailed and accurate defect reports. Follows all defects through to resolution and closure.              Applies a basic knowledge of procedures, methodology and/or application standards to include payment card industry and security related compliance to testing activities.              Acts as a single point of contact for assigned small, less complex client projects with regard to test activities. Coordinates the test activities assigned to the test team to include, reviewing of client test plans cases and scripts, prioritizing test execution when necessary and providing feedback to internal and external clients. column2: The role is permanent full-time. It would be great if you    have 2 to 5 years of experience in manual/exploratory testing. But we are open to varying experience levels.           Our team is located in Ahmedabad, but you can be located anywhere in India and willing to work remotely. You are also welcome to work from our office; we have a hybrid model.         It would be great to have experience with automated testing tools like Cypress; otherwise, we would train you on using one.         It would help if you have worked with an Agile Scrum team and are familiar with cloud-native Micro Service-based application environments.         It would be nice to be familiar with AWS cloud, Node.JS and work with Docker Containers and CI/CD code pipelines.         We would be absolutely thrilled to work with you; if you know JavaScript, are familiar with Chrome DevTools, and can use test frameworks like Mocha, Jest, and test Restful APIs.         Everything apart, you should be good at analysis and documentation and demonstrate great writing skills (of course, we will let you use Grammarly).         And of course, you should have an eye for details as you know how developers are; they will always have something for you to correct.     About You      You are self-initiated and can work independently. You can take complete ownership and are comfortable working with no or minimal supervision.xperience levels.         You enjoy contributing like an analyst, like to grasp the business domain, understand user behavior, and are focused on improving customer experience.         You understand the importance of quality and are confident that your tests check everything end-to-end to ensure nothing goes wrong in production.         You like to test early and as often as possible and release daily or in short iterations.         You dont treat the front-end as an afterthought. You understand that a good user interface is an absolute must, and make sure from all the angels that we are delivering a good experience.         You are a learner. You love to experiment with new tools, learn new skills, and always find new ways to improve things.

column2: As a Test Engineer, you will work with product managers, developers and other testers to ensure the continued high quality of our growing suite of software products.          Specifically, you will:                Work with other members of the wider product team to understand and analyse new product features, determine the optimal test approach for such features, and create the necessary test artefacts, such as test plans, test suites, test cases, etc      Execute product testing, covering both new feature testing and regression testing. Create clear and concise bug records where observed and expected results differ. Support developers as required to understand and resolve such bugs, and conduct retesting to verify resolution.      Report on test progress and status on regular stand-up meetings, and be able to assess and articulate the risk and impact of any bugs identified during testing.    Ensure your work conforms to testing best practices.      Write clear and well-structured documentation, such as test cases, bug reports, and user guides. Provide product support and perform an SME role, educating colleagues in the use of new product features, as well as helping to analyse issues reported by project teams and customers. Support and mentor more junior members of the team.        As a Test Engineer in the Chennai office you will be working with and testing applications that run on the Salesforce Lightning Platform as well as other leading cloud platforms such as Heroku, Amazon Web Services and others. You will be testing products developed using a variety of established and evolving web technologies such as Node.js, JavaScript, TypeScript, AngularJS, HTML and CSS.            Person specification        This role will suit a highly motivated self-starter who is comfortable working in teams that may be spread across a number of different locations. In addition you will:              Be a quick learner and keen to embrace new technologies and platforms      Be a clear communicator and team player      Be able to work under your own initiative      Be able to write documents in clear English      Have a talent for problem solving and a well-organised approach to work      Stay abreast of the latest thinking and trends in software testing              Competencies: Knowledge, Skills & Abilities              Candidates must have minimum 3 years commercial software testing experience and be educated to degree level in a relevant technical subject.          Essential                Knowledge and experience of software testing concepts, including web-application testing      Good understanding of the software development lifecycle and Agile methodologies      Experience writing and curating test cases, and preparing test data        Feature testing, regression testing, and exploratory testing experience        Experience raising and tracking bugs, including retesting        Experience writing client-facing documents such as user guides        Experience in providing constructive feedback to enhance the user experience              Desirable                Experience working in an agile environment      Automation testing, including hands-on scripting using Selenium or similar frameworks      Integration testing      API testing, writing stubs/drivers to test the integration points of one or more systems      Programming experience in any language but particularly Apex, Java, C#, JavaScript, or Node.js.      Experience working with Heroku or other Platform-as-a-Service products      Ability to use simple SQL or SOQL to query databases

column2: We are seeking an experienced QA Engineer with BA experience who can operate independently and take accountability for driving and leading automation of quality assurance as part of the Intelligence Engineering Platforms (IEP) Pillar under Enterprise Data & Analytics (eDnA) Organization. As a Lead Automation Engineer, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the quality and reliability of our products/services through automated testing strategies. The role includes leading and innovating to ensure product quality, developing both manual and automated tests, and maintaining them. You will collaborate with various stakeholders, monitoring the performance of Intelligent Automation systems, and managing complex projects deliverables. You will also create and document test strategies and plans, develop test scripts using automation tools, and perform database testing.  Responsibilities: Lead and innovate to ensure product and integration quality. Influence the quality strategy for products, including both manual and automated testing. Identify, define and document manual and automated test strategies, plans & scripts for DW and Power BI using requirement documentation, wireframes, and comps. Ensure the quality, reusability, and maintainability of automation code through reviews and standards. Collaborate with stakeholders to foster a quality culture and a proactive approach to finding defects. Work with architects, product owners, and analysts to understand requirements and develop robust testing suites. Provide technical leadership and coaching to the QA team. Advocate for practices that advance Continuous Delivery & Continuous Improvement. Design and develop test scripts using automation tools like Selenium WebDriver/UI Path, Azure Test Plan, iCEDQ, QuerySurge, etc. Maintain test traceability and reusability for regression cycles. Lead defect triage meetings and defect replication/analysis. Log, track, monitor & perform RCA for defects logged in tools like testrail, devops. Monitor the performance of Intelligent Automation systems to ensure smooth operations. Collaborate with developers to enhance and update existing automation solutions. Generate reports on system performance, issue resolution, and automation efficiency. Perform key engineering tasks such as detailed design, interface definition, data mapping, CI/CD pipeline integration, and SME support. Ensure automation solutions comply with security and compliance standards. Establish milestones for sprints and releases to deliver solutions to prioritized requirements. Proficient in Agile techniques and implement test methodologies. Validate APIs using tools like Postman, SOAP UI, REST services. Participate in Paired Programming with the Engineering team to shift the test cycle earlier in the sprint. Regularly interact with Business UAT/Product Owners/Scrum Masters during the sprint cycle.  Qualifications Software Quality Assurance Testing:o8-10 years of experience in test scenario and test case design, development, and maintenance.o5+ years of automation testing experience, including defining and implementing automation test strategies. Manual Testing:oMinimum of 4 years of experience in manual functional and end-to-end testing, with a focus on Data Quality and Analytics. Technical Skills:oProficiency in one or more programming languages, software engineering methodologies, and technologies.oFamiliarity with software quality automation tools for data warehouses, such as Azure Test Plan, iCEDQ, and QuerySurge.oExperience with major cloud platforms like Auzre, AWS, GCP etc.oProficient in data warehouse testing using SQL, Python, Azure Data factory, Informatica etc.oFamiliarity with Version control tools like Git, BitBucket etc.oExposure to continuous testing tools such as Azure DevOps and Jenkins. Soft Skills:oStrong technical aptitude and familiarity with software development and automated testing techniques.oExcellent analytical and problem-solving abilities.oDemonstrated ability to translate business requirements into test strategies and test cases.oEffective communication skills, with the ability to collaborate and build solid relationships with team members.

The cryptographic electronics and microprocessor, housed within a tamper-responding container, provide a secure cryptographic environment, designed to meet FIPS 140-2 Level 4 requirements. column2: This position requires proven skill in test development and methodologies. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of testing within a distributed software system as well as an end-to-end understanding of common testing/QA tools and practices. We expect the ideal candidate to scope, design, implement, and maintain tests for new projects, and to work both independently as well as in collaboration with the development staff in an agile environment.      The Software Engineer in Test will drive the end to end testing software product development projects in the area of Deployment Monitoring Solutions. These applications are fully developed at the Pune RD Center and are used globally in hospitals and cancer centers.       Position Duties:           Establish and evolve formal QA processes, ensuring that the team is using industry-accepted best practices.         Oversee all aspects of quality assurance including establishing metrics, applying industry best practices, and developing new tools and processes to ensure quality goals are met.         Lead and mentor QA team members, as well as manage outside contract testers.         Perform Integration, Component, end-to-end, Functional, Security, Performance, Scalability Reliability testing.         Develop and maintain an effective test framework.         Design and implement an efficient continuous integration and test infrastructure that enables    daily build test    practices in the project.         Design, develop, implement and execute automation test scripts.         Maintain and manage the automation test environments.         Work collaboratively with development and the QA team to identify and develop test cases and suites that ensure adequate coverage.         Assist in troubleshooting, as well as failure analysis of issues identified from the automation suite.         Review product specifications and requirements with Product Managers, Engineers and other scrum team members to establish testing requirements.         Apply agile test-driven development practices and ensure build is shippable quality after every sprint.         Align test artifacts to scrum deliverables and efficiently test design specs, test execution results, test traceability matrix from the test suites.         Analyze verification and validation strategies, and drive towards reducing overlaps         Define and publish metrics (Key Performance Indicators) that measures effectiveness of test practices.               Qualifications Required:     BE, MSc, MCA, Computer Science or related discipline.         Number of year s related experience:    5-8 years         Special Knowledge / Skills:        Required:           Strong software programming skills in object-oriented languages C#.NET/Java.         Hands-on with strong experience in identifying test scenarios from the requirements.         Strong database skills in SQLDB.         Experience in testing distributed systems or microservices architecture.         Software testing skills with the aptitude for automation testing along with excellent debugging skills.         Experience with deploying and managing complex Enterprise Software products in a private / hybrid / public cloud like Microsoft Azure. column2: We have a requirement for two testers to join as test analysts within the Customer & Data Test Delivery team - Oracle Service Bus (OSB) Replacement program     The role for each involves working as part of a collaborative Team alongside developers, technical support, Subject Matter experts and Business Users.      As one of the team members you will become the Test Stream Owner for several Web     Services identified for migration from OSB to BizTalk with focus on technical (API layer) and manual (Functional) testing.         As a tester and assigned Test Stream Owner for a Web Service in a Scrum team, you will need to:         Break down components under test, investigate, identify and capture E2E data flows from calling applications to target applications.     Deep dive into existing Web Service Operations and data fields to analyse and ensure business and technical requirements are fully understood in readiness to Test the migration from OSB to BizTalk.     Produce test documentation (test plans and test scripts) to the agreed standard.     Identify and carry out regression testing where appropriate.     Report defects accurately and manage through to successful resolution via Dev-Ops.     Report testing progress by communicating effectively and escalating where appropriate.     Create and maintain product knowledge documentation for use within the team.     Assist with any functional queries that may arise from business users following releases.     Collaborate with other testing specialists within and beyond the OSB     Replacement Project on testing excellence.     Work transparently with the team in a hybrid/remote environment.     Developing strong and trusting relationships with business and development representatives both within the project team and the wider YW organisation.     Call out blockers and work tirelessly with the team to unblock.         PREFERRED SKILLS         Contribute towards the technical decisions within a collaborative team environment, including architecture, estimation, product planning, user story/requirement creation. Able to express your own opinions, and be pragmatic about modifying them when appropriate.     Logical and creative thinking skills     Ability to work independently and to take ownership - and use own initiative.     Ability to work under pressure and to tight deadlines.     Proven experience of working with daily releases and high output of development work.     Ability to react well to changing requirements with a positive attitude.     Commitment to quality and a thorough approach to work with excellent attention to detail.     Proactive approach to own personal development.     Experienced at working with blended teams of personnel including permanent, contract and 3rd party personnel. column2: At IBM, work is more than a job its a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things youve never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the worlds most challenging problems? If so, let's talk. Your Role and Responsibilities We are seeking a Test Engineer to join an existing seasoned team, with the primary goal of evaluating our software suite via automation, and manual validation. You will work under the direction of senior test team members, with product managers and developers. As a test engineer, you will be responsible for persona driven scenario validations of defined feature areas, new products, and cross suite interactivity/dependencies of a larger software suite.  Our success will be driven by your real passion for quality of product for our end users. Job one, will be to insure the customer is always spoken for, and has the best experience possible with our application. Your future team is the definition of cross suite, and prides itself on having the opposite of the ""not my job"" attitude.  Writing advanced automation scripts, editing existing scripts, and debugging automation code efficiently. Growing a multi tool automation suite of tests using existing frameworks (Selenide/Selenium). Ensuring that the automation output is clear, precise and up to date. Should be able to write nes frameworks from scratch. Capable of working with a team as requirements are gathered, and actively participating in conversations, then translating into actionable stories and tasks.  Active participation in a multi silo scrum team (PM, DEV, TEST), from planning, tasking, validation and release  Test case creation, and review with stake holders.  Required Technical and Professional Expertise Focuses on gaining an understanding of the automation framework architecture and the why behind architectural decisions. Gains an end-to-end understanding of the way an automation test system is designed, developed, tested, deployed, and operated Demonstrates ability to independently design and deliver small to mid-sized features; proactively makes changes to maintain and improve systems. Code reviews are uneventful. Participates in the teams dev-ops work; handles most tasks and incidents independently. Seeks to identify quality and reliability issues in the systems they maintain and suggest Improvements Is aware of the test methodologies & has a deep understanding of the test metrics. Will be aware of the test plans & can take complete ownership of a certain component or service tests Will be able to develop modify automation test suite for the medium complex features and own it Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise Efficient programming skills. column2: MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES  The Applications Quality Assurance organization provides a wide range of QA services for the company's business applications. The services include: System Development Life Cycle (SDLC), test planning, test preparation, manual and automated test execution, and defect management. This position will also assist in Performance Monitoring, System Monitoring, and User Acceptance testing.  The Quality Assurance Analyst will work on a daily basis with IT team members, business owners (Product Owners), field employees, consultants and vendors. Responsible for all levels of testing: system integration, user acceptance, and regression. Responsible for test management, regression testing, design, test automation, performance and reporting using the Azure DevOps tools suite.  Responsible for testing multiple complex projects ranging from small to large. Responsible for assisting Software Development in debugging and defect resolution for both internal and external applications.  Must maintain an excellent business owner relationship and for some projects be asked to clarify requirements to complete testing. Responsible for documenting and reporting issues and resolution.  Must be familiar with PCI and Sarbanes-Oxley compliance.  MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS Associate degree with 3 to 5 years business experience directly related to the responsibilities. At least 4 years of experience in a QA environment, with a proven technical understanding of Microsoft platforms, application development, and web application environments. Must be experienced in test engineering concepts including testing principles and concepts, building a test environment, tracking defects and communicating testing status.  Demonstrated work experience with automated, regression and stress testing. Preferably experience with Postman, Azure DevOps, API testing. Excellent customer service skills. Demonstrated written and verbal communication skills. Demonstrated success in managing customer requirements or demands Proven ability to perform multiple tasks simultaneously. Excellent attention to detail. Ability to work both individually and as a team member. SP+ is an equal opportunity employer committed in policy and practice to recruit, hire, train, and promote, in all job classifications, without regard to race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, age, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, sexual orientation, veteran status, gender identity, disability or other classes protected by federal or state law. SP+ does not tolerate harassment or retaliation against any employee or applicant based on these characteristics or because the individual exercised their EEO rights.

column2: General:                 The QA engineering professional is expected to deliver the day to day test activities, optimising quality, coverage, velocity and enhancement of tests in the context of the test strategy (ies).              A key purpose of this role is to be contribute to analysis of complex or new solutions from a test design perspective, including use of test techniques.             The role contributes to the review of design specifications             They will plan, design, execute and report of tests, using appropriate testing tools and techniques and conforming to agreed standards to assure the test quality.             Influencing the testing with business acumen of relevant technologies and applying that knowledge of a technology to the test scenario.             Performs test analysis on complex or new solutions.             Apply test expertise in the static testing phases to identifiy defects early, including but not restricted to during Requirements Validation and Design reviews.             Undertake diagnostics, understanding the complete end to end solution design to work out where the issue exists. Advising the appropriate teams where the issue exists.             Contributes to the creation of project test strategies in their particular domain, providing recommendations to the test manager based on their area of knowledge.                     Subject matter expertise:                     May be a Subject Matter Expert in at least one test function, a technical or business domain ideally in Contact Centre Deliveries, Genesys, Cisco WebEx, Five9 s. Where a test specialism is held, the purpose of the role is to improve the quality of testing being undertaken related to their specialism, by applying their knowledge of the specialism to the activities performed by the test organisation.             Expertise across both functional and non functional testing for contact centre solutions including but not limited to manual and automated functional testing, HA/resilience/failover testing, Disaster Recovery Business Continuity testing, Load/Performace/Stress testing.                     Improve quality:                     Provide support to improve the quality, effectiveness and efficiency of testing within their business unit with respect to their specialism.             Supporting the adherence to the test strategy and processes being followed for a programme                     Coaching:                     You share knowledge and information to directly benefit or support others within the testing domain                     Third Party involvement:                     May contribute to the creation and execution of a plan to review/monitor the activities of third party test resource                     Reporting:                     Reporting on the test progress to test manager and appropriate stakeholders both internal and external             Provides recommendations and advice towards management decisions on matters relating to test projects AND the test organisation in which they work, including new test tools, customer disclosure information, training options for their teams                         Skills Required:                     Skills for core activities:                     Responsible for supporting the stakeholder acceptance teams - including witness testing, being on site with the customer, reviewing test activities, defects, data and test documents produced by third party test resource as part of an established project assurance plan.             Providing the analysis during a conflict situation when determining where the issue exists e.g. in a component situation.             Operates methods to assure the quality and coverage of tests written for their area, against the business requirements.             Able to support, define and lead on day to day testing activities for their area of responsibility (internally or externally facing)             Establishes and operates periodic test progress and results reporting for key stakeholders.             Undertakes ongoing analysis of test progress against plan to identify risks to and issues with successful test completion; addresses those risks and issues as appropriate seeking guidance within the test unit when required.             Supporting the validation of test estimates             Delivering optimum test execution rates by liaising with customers, vendors, project and programme management alike and reliably delivers results.             Organises defect triage and diagnostics for complex defects needing input from multiple teams.             Works collaboratively across all relevant teams             Perform traceability activities.                     Skills for broader activities:                     Attend supplier-facing events in capacity as a Test professional, providing assurance of the supplier testing activities and/or services and products, by executing or witnessing on site testing.             Will have commercial awareness and ability to apply that to their activities.                     Cross skill collaboration:                     Contributor to BT test Academy/professional community in the capacity of a test professional, supporting test analysis as a skillset of the community.             Contributor and owner of Verify CI initiatives in the capacity of a test professional, supporting the planning, delivery and execution of these initiatives.                     Problem solving:                     Identify and resolve any problem within your control or contribute expertly to the resolution of any problems that threaten successful completion of testing to meet project objectives.             Enhance overall effectiveness and efficiency of testing on an ongoing basis -release on release.             Analyse production defects, finding ways to discover/remove them before they reach production in future.             Interpretation of designs, requirements and use cases into test scripts.             Evaluation of working practice, tools, environments etc. for continuous improvement.             Contribute to resolution of functional and non functional problems with a test environment or solution under test.             Solve any problem within your control or contribute expertly to the resolution of any problem arising during the definition and sourcing of the data required for a test set.             Solve any problem within your control or contribute expertly to the resolution of any problem arising during the set-up and configuration of diagnostics tools.             Retesting of defects.             Identification of the likely organisation to resolve the defect identified.             Solve any problem within your control or contribute expertly to the resolution of any problems arising when associates encounter tool issues.                     Change Management:                     Managing change control of all aspects of the testing within their remit against the attendant changes in project requirements, design, timescales, priorities, direction etc.             May make recommendation for the change of testing scope for a bundle/package of test activity when circumstances suggest the scope is no longer valid.             May make recommendation on the way testing is being conducted on a test project AND as a test team.                     Experience Required:                     Technical skills:                     The individual is comfortable in the role of test professional and has developed a wide spread of skills in the role to which they are assigned, still refer to the mentorship of test managers on occasion, can now perform most tasks unaided. At this level, an experienced tester may now be branching out into a field of test specialism.             The individual is comfortable in the field of Contact Centre Solutions, across a range of platforms, able to understand complex design documents, identify test requirements and apply technical skills in the identification and execution of tests.                     Preferred Technical Skills:                     Test automation             XRay JIRA for test and defect management                     Expected Experience:                     Senior stakeholders may include Solution Architects, Programme Manager, Test Manager/Architect, Service Managers.             In order to achieve this, the role requires a minimum of 3-5 years experience of delivering testing on complex programmes.             Working towards a foundation qualification in testing ISTQB or equivalent.             Working towards membership of a professional body ie. BCS, IET, IEEE or building equivalent, required knowledge and experience (as appropriate to the role).                 Why this job matters         The QA Engineering Professional supports the critical testing activities for a portfolio of products and services, following best practice standards for test quality, resource planning and issue resolution, in alignment to business strategy and requirements.             What you ll be doing         1. Undertakes first level diagnostics, diagnosing defects against components using techniques and tools defined in the test strategy, identifies defects against the correct component in multi-component journeys, writes test specifications and test designs (scripts) and runs the test scripts to time cost and quality   2. Supports the full lifecycle integration testing to support project deliverables    3. Supports the team within its defined area to develop reports on accuracy, quality and errors in test diagnosis against the associated business or customer KPIs   4. Executes automation, functional, regression and load testing scenarios, applying solutions that validate the functionality of applications   5. Supports the maintenance of test suites and ensures high-velocity, high-quality production pushes using manual tests   6. Supports the communication of complexities of internal systems to help test against known issues   7. Assesses and suggests ways to mitigate risks that have an impact on the quality of products and services   8. Supports in the implementation of ways to improve working processes within the area of QA engineering responsibility             The skills you ll need         Manual/Automation Testing     Requirements Gathering     Regression Testing     System Integration Testing     Functional/Non-Functional Testing     Programming/Scripting     Version Control     Test Case Design/Writing     Agile Methodologies     Software Testing     Software Development Lifecycle     Decision Making     Defect Tracking     Growth Mindset     Inclusive Leadership
column11: Change management, Load testing, Test scripts, Testing tools, Functional testing, Disaster recovery, Agile, Regression testing, JIRA, cisco

column2: Title: Payments Testing Specialist (Finserv Vision Plus) Job Description: Position Overview:  We are currently seeking a skilled Payments Testing Specialist with hands-on experience in Finserv Vision Plus, specializing in payments-related testing. The ideal candidate will play a crucial role in ensuring the quality and reliability of payment systems through Selenium automation testing, test management, problem resolution, and consulting. This position requires active collaboration with clients in Agile development environments and effective coordination with all stakeholders involved in the project. Key Responsibilities: Finserv Vision Plus Expertise:  Utilize your expertise in Finserv Vision Plus to conduct comprehensive testing of payment systems, ensuring accuracy, reliability, and compliance with industry standards and regulations. Payments Testing:  Lead and participate in payments-related testing activities, including functional testing, regression testing, and performance testing, to validate system behavior and ensure seamless payment processing. Selenium Automation Testing:  Develop, maintain, and execute Selenium automation test scripts to automate repetitive testing tasks, improve test coverage, and accelerate the testing process for payment systems. Test Management:  Take ownership of test management activities, including test planning, execution, and reporting, using tools and frameworks to organize, prioritize, and track testing efforts effectively. Automation Testing Problem Resolution:  Identify, troubleshoot, and resolve automation testing issues and challenges encountered during the testing lifecycle, ensuring timely resolution and minimal disruption to project timelines. Consulting and Client Collaboration:  Collaborate closely with clients to understand their requirements, provide expert advice on testing strategies and best practices, and ensure alignment between technical solutions and business objectives. Agile Development Methodology:  Work within Agile development teams, participating in sprint planning, daily stand-ups, and sprint reviews to deliver high-quality payment solutions iteratively and incrementally. Stakeholder Coordination:  Facilitate effective communication and collaboration among all stakeholders involved in the project, including developers, testers, business analysts, and project managers, to ensure shared understanding and alignment on project goals and deliverables.
column11: Banking Financial Services, Payments, Selenium, finserv, SQL

column2: Responsibilities A day in the life of an Infoscion As part of the Infosys consulting team, your primary role would be to actively aid the consulting team in different phases of the project including problem definition, effort estimation, diagnosis, solution generation and design and deployment  You will explore the alternatives to the recommended solutions based on research that includes literature surveys, information available in public domains, vendor evaluation information, etc. and build POCs  You will create requirement specifications from the business needs, define the to-be-processes and detailed functional designs based on requirements.  You will support configuring solution requirements on the products; understand if any issues, diagnose the root-cause of such issues, seek clarifications, and then identify and shortlist solution alternatives  You will also contribute to unit-level and organizational initiatives with an objective of providing high quality value adding solutions to customers. If you think you fit right in to help our clients navigate their next in their digital transformation journey, this is the place for you!A day in the life of an Infoscion As part of the Infosys testing team, your primary role would be to anchor testing requirements, develop test strategy, track & monitor project plans, review test plans, test cases and test scripts.  You will develop project quality plans, validate defective prevention plans to deliver effective testing solutions for clients.  You will ensure right test environment is available and provide necessary review feedback for test data setup to ensure timely commencement of test execution  You will validate "go live" activities such as production verification to ensure that the application runs in the production environment without any issues.  In addition, you will mentor the team and provide regular feedback and coaching to help them continually improve their performance If you think you fit right in to help our clients navigate their next in their digital transformation journey, this is the place for you! column2: Responsibilities A day in the life of an Infoscion As part of the Infosys consulting team, your primary role would be to actively aid the consulting team in different phases of the project including problem definition, effort estimation, diagnosis, solution generation and design and deployment  You will explore the alternatives to the recommended solutions based on research that includes literature surveys, information available in public domains, vendor evaluation information, etc. and build POCs  You will create requirement specifications from the business needs, define the to-be-processes and detailed functional designs based on requirements. You will support configuring solution requirements on the products; understand if any issues, diagnose the root-cause of such issues, seek clarifications, and then identify and shortlist solution alternatives You will also contribute to unit-level and organizational initiatives with an objective of providing high quality value adding solutions to customers. If you think you fit right in to help our clients navigate their next in their digital transformation journey, this is the place for you!A day in the life of an Infoscion As part of the Infosys testing team, your primary role would be to anchor testing requirements, develop test strategy, track & monitor project plans, review test plans, test cases and test scripts.  You will develop project quality plans, validate defective prevention plans to deliver effective testing solutions for clients. You will ensure right test environment is available and provide necessary review feedback for test data setup to ensure timely commencement of test execution You will validate "go live" activities such as production verification to ensure that the application runs in the production environment without any issues. In addition, you will mentor the team and provide regular feedback and coaching to help them continually improve their performance If you think you fit right in to help our clients navigate their next in their digital transformation journey, this is the place for you! Technical and Professional Requirements: Primary skills:Technology->Data Services Testing->Data Warehouse Testing,Technology->ETL & Data Quality->ETL - Others  Preferred Skills: Technology->ETL & Data Quality->ETL - Others  Technology->Data Services Testing->Data Warehouse Testing  Additional Responsibilities: Possess end-to-end knowledge and experience in testing Extensive experience in test planning/ test strategy, test estimates Excellent communication and client handling skills Experience in one or more scripting languages and automation tools Analytical, Client interfacing and stakeholder management skills  Knowledge of SDLC and agile methodologies  Project and Team Management  Educational Requirements Bachelor of Engineering  Service Line Infosys Quality Engineering *  Location of posting is subject to business requirements

column2: Works with developers and business application users to develop comprehensive test plans and detailed test cases, including the use of automation, performance and test management tools. Develops, modifies, and executes software test plans, automated scripts and programs for testing. Analyzes and writes test standards and procedures. Maintains documentation of test results to assist in debugging and modification of software. Analyzes test results to ensure existing functionality and recommends corrective action. Consults with development engineers in resolution of problems.     JOB SUMMARY:     The Quality Assurance Engineer is responsible for testing MINDBODY applications, diagnosing problems and reporting bugs. The Quality Assurance Engineer has prior experience with testing, excellent attention to detail, strong analytical, technical and communication skills. In addition, the Quality Assurance Engineer understands the MINDBODY technologies and products. Responsible to improve the automation coverage.     MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS AND REQUIREMENTS:     Bachelors Degree in Computer Science, or equivalent experience   5+ years of industry experience in testing web applications, mobile applications and/or large-scale enterprise products   Strong understanding of best practices in software testing, test planning, test case writing and defect writing   Strong understanding of SDLC development processes   Basic understanding of TDD/BDD and CI/CD processes   Hands-on experience writing code in OOP languages (C#/Java/Objective-C/Swift)   Hands-on experience with SQL and relational databases (T-SQL, MySQL, MongoDB)   Hands-on experience troubleshooting issues in front-end applications and back-end code   Hands-on experience executing and implementing automated tests   Hands-on experience communicating with team members to provide support throughout development life cycle   Good communication and collaborations skills.     PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS AND REQUIREMENTS:   Hands-on experience with API testing tools (Postman, SoapUI, Advanced REST Client)   Hands-on experience with large-scale analytics platforms (New Relic, Splunk, PRTG)   Hands-on experience with browser development tools (Chrome DevTools, Firefox Developer Tools)   Hands-on experience with version control software (Git, TFVC)   Hands-on experience with code editors (Visual Studio, Android Studio, Xcode)   Hands-on experience with bug/project tracking software (Azure Dev-Ops, JIRA)   Hands-on experience with continuous integration tools (Jenkins, TeamCity, Travis CI, TFS)   Hands-on experience with scripting languages (Python/Bash/JavaScript/Ruby)     PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:   Collaborate with QA engineers to determine test strategy for project   Review new code for potential defects and develop test strategies from findings   Track own open defects and provide support until resolution   Propose technical solutions to remediate defects in code   Create simple automated tests using established automation tools and frameworks   Write complex SQL queries to facilitate own testing and work of other QA engineers   Propose improvements to SDLC/Agile practices of project   Accurately estimate level of effort for own testing tasks   Create and maintain basic documentation for established QA best practices   Collaborate with software engineers to communicate details of own testing efforts and provide support throughout development life cycle   Implement solutions to utilize continuous integration servers effectively   Create simple software tools to facilitate testing   Troubleshoot and track defects for testing environments and infrastructure   Report into QA metrics as per definitions from department.   Mentor junior QA members.

identifying their underlying cause and seeing them through to resolution and liaising with other teams where appropriate         Producing descriptive and concise bug reports that evidence the functionality of a solution         Communicating status information and issues to a variety of stakeholders, adapting appropriately depending on the audience         Knowledge and experience required:         Senior level experience in testing data solutions, covering Data Warehouses, ETL/ELT processes and dimensional modelling concepts         Ability to create, adapt and execute effective test strategies         Ability to think creatively, problem solve and innovate         Extensive experience in database and BI technologies         Experience in testing data and storage services in Azure (Azure SQL Database, Data Lake and data storage)         Extensive experience in testing BI reports, dashboards, datasets and data models         Experience in agile software development methodologies including BDD TDD         Extensive experience in different test automation tools and technology         Experience in creating and maintaining automated tests for REST APIs         Solid understanding of testing pyramid and experience in implementing it at different levels         Experience working in a continuous integration and delivery environment         Working knowledge of product/defect/test case management systems         Advanced SQL with a solid understanding of database structures         Attention to detail, taking nothing for granted       This is a technical role and as such you will need a broad technical knowledge including, but not limited to, the following areas:           SQL         Azure Data Services (SQL, Data Factory, Databricks)         Power BI           Python             Azure DevOps             Business Objects             Crystal Reports             Azure DevOps             Git

column2: Business unit: Projects and Technology Experience Level:  Experienced Professionals Where you fit in This is a fantastic opportunity for an experienced Senior QA looking to expand their knowledge and be part of a strategic program that will revolutionize the business. You will be working on a Greenfield, Cloud hosted Endur implementation, playing a key role in performing various stages of testing. You will be bringing your expertise to the team, working hand-in-hand with dedicated BA, SMEs and developers to bring in best test practices, drive all the stages of test phases from end to end and ensure high quality delivery through the team. A sense of team ownership and empowerment will be fostered. Not only this, but the expansive reach of this program will give individuals the opportunity to build the depth of their end-to-end trading life cycle experience and expand their knowledge into new commodities. What's your role As a Lead, you will be responsible to plan and undertake end-to-end test activities such as Strategizing testing for releases including estimations and resourcing in line with Project and Program needs, test script development, test execution & defects management. Work collaboratively with Product Managers/ Business Analysts in project to assess test scenarios and provide test requirements based on risk-based testing methodology. Design and Develop Test strategy, Test plan, Test reporting, test conditions, test scripts, test data, and expected results for test streams, including Product Test, Integration Test, Technical Test and Deployment Test. You will provide a practical approach to complex testing, specifically in the areas of the automation of test cases for the purposes of regression testing. Consult and implement right-fit test automation approach. You will be building up and leading the Testing Team to the success of project. Defining the scope of testing within the context of each release delivery. Applying the appropriate test measurements and metrics in the Testing Team. Experience in identifying and implementing process improvements that improve the level of delivery while finding optimization opportunities. Ensuring Test Delivery Assurance complying with Shell standard tools and framework. Experienced virtual team worker with ability to work across time, geographical, and cultural boundaries. Leadership skills and ability to drive change using influence and networking. Good team player and effective leader with a long-term vision. What we need from you At least 8 to 12 years of QA experience with Test Lead experience At least 5 years in ETRM/Endur Bachelor's Degree related to IT or equivalent Experienced in commodity trading business - Gas, Power, carbon, environmental products Testing Endur Core Functionality Experienced in Front Office, Mid Office, Back Office and connected apps like SAP, ETRM systems Experienced in End of Day (EOD) and batch processes - Including Instrument fixings, Simulation, reporting Basic SQL and Endur Data model Experience in automation test Experienced in Azure DevOps Experience in Kafka is a plus Experience in Monitoring solutions Azure Insights Grafana etc. is a plus

Whether the testing is manual, automated, or cognitive, you hold a key role in releasing the best deliverables to IBMers and our clients. Your Role and Responsibilities As a Middleware Testing Practitioner, you will design, build, test and deploy effective testing solutions which reduce the amount of manual effort in the testing process.  You are responsible for applying automated tools to support the testing of applications across all phases of the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC)  You need to support the test team by recommending tools and processes to automate other test activities, such as test management, reporting, test data generation and defect management.  Required Technical and Professional Expertise 4 years of SDET and testing experience  Knowledge of Internet/Web Technologies is a must.  Experience in Working on Tools like SOAP UI, CA Lisa, Para soft, or similar tools. Using Rest Assured or other API Test automation Frameworks Knowledge of WebSphere MQ and IBM Integration Bus (IIB) good to have  Excellent coding skills in JavaScript or Java  Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise Experience in -Data model understanding Database queries and knowledge on NOSQL platforms  Test automation and strategy design over distributed systems Solving/debugging issues from Production systems by coordinating with remote teams across different verticals (QA, Dev, PM, and Operations) Understanding of automation tests with stub and mocked data from integrated systems

column2: Business unit: Projects and Technology Experience Level:  Experienced Professionals Job Description:  Where you fit in This is a fantastic opportunity for an experienced QA looking to expand their knowledge and be part of a strategic program that will revolutionize the business. You will be working on a Greenfield, Cloud hosted Endur implementation, playing a key role in performing various stages of testing. You will be bringing your expertise to the team, working hand-in-hand with dedicated BA, SMEs and developers to understand and develop test scenarios, building test packs required for functional, regression and integrations, design and automate the test approaches and defects management. A sense of team ownership and empowerment will be fostered. Not only this, but the expansive reach of this program will give individuals the opportunity to build the depth of their end-to-end trading life cycle experience and expand their knowledge into new commodities. What's the role Support Endur & its associate interfaces in the landscape from a Functional standpoint. As an Endur Tester the resource will work on project, discretionary, operational items. This would include Requirement Analysis, Formulating test scenarios, Acceptance Criteria, and Acceptance Test Plan and Management. Regression testing, System Testing, System integration, and E2E process testing for new modules, and projects. Liaising with a diverse set of business and IT stakeholders. Design and build automation test frameworks. Bug verification, tracking and fixing. Test preparation, test design, execution, and reporting. Defect management lifecycle. Track and publish the status or development, maintenance, and execution of automation test suits. Work as a key member of the Delivery Team to understand requirements and technical solutions under test. Work with manual and integration testers, developers, and BAs to understand the business domain, and the system functionality. Utilize the approved test automation frameworks to develop automation in a fast-paced agile environment. What we need from you Overall 5+ years of experience in Software Testing. At least 3 years in ETRM. Bachelor's Degree related to IT or equivalent Experience in commodity trading business - Gas, Power, carbon, environmental products. Experience in FO, MO, BO and connected apps like SAP, Price management systems. Experience in End of Day (EOD) and batch processes Basic SQL and Endur Data model. Experience in Endur application with knowledge of data model. Experience in automation test. Experience in Azure DevOps. Experience in Kafka is a plus. Experience in Monitoring solutions Azure Insights Grafana etc. is a plus

column2: We are looking for an individual who is passionate about quality assurance     The quality assurance (QA) analyst will participate as part of a cross-functional Agile team and will advocate for and ensure quality for their team     You will participate in development design sessions and provide feedback from a quality perspective     You will coordinate best quality practices across other teams         Are you the person we're looking for         Proven success with manual testing tools and technologies     4 - 6 years of experience in the field is a must     Your testing experiences include planning, assessments, test case creation and maintenance     Automation experience is desirable but it s not a must         The technologies we are looking for include some of the following:         TestRail or other TC repository tool     BDD     TDD     Desktop applications     Mobile applications     Restful APIs     Atlassian suite (Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket)          Knowledge on Jira/TestRail connectivity with Squish is a plus     SQL     Squish (desirable)     Selenium (desirable)         Natural collaborator.          You work effectively with developers, BA s, Product Managers, and customers to draft test plans and test cases from an established set of requirements     You are proficient with Agile and a collaborative cross functional approach to building awesome software     You are comfortable working with offshore teams and collaborating on best practices across multiple Agile teams     You constantly seek opinions and solicit feedback in an effort to create the best work possible     You don t know any other way     It's a team effort -- and you completely appreciate that         Confident and deliberate communicator.          You have a point of view and you're completely comfortable defending it to any person or group, regardless of level or status     It s a confidence that comes from experience     And that s not to say you aren t open to different views; but, when you feel strongly about a particular matter, you don t give up easily     you're at ease with lively debate -- in fact, you welcome it     Your points are clear and concise     And you're equally as respected for your knowledge and expertise as for your style and approach         Resourcefulness and application.         At Aptos, we have a pioneering spirit -- when we have questions, we find answers; when we're faced with challenges, we find solutions     We turn to a variety of resources, including our own colleagues, our professional network, the Internet, articles and books -- whatever helps us get the job done     But it s not just about using a variety of resources to gain knowledge -- it's also about applying that knowledge to other areas of the job or business where it might make sense         Quality orientation.          You rarely make mistakes because you have good processes in place to ensure that every last detail is correct     But in those rare occasions when errors are realized (let s face it, it happens to the best of us from time to time), you own them, correct them, learn from them, and then quickly adjust and communicate processes to ensure the same mistake doesn t happen twice     It's your transparency, authenticity and humility is what sets you apart from the rest         Stays cool when things get crazy.          We're growing fast which translates to an ever-changing, super fast-paced work environment     This may involve immediate changes to plans and timelines     Your ability to quickly analyze situations and effectively prioritize tasks is what sets you apart from the rest     Rest assured: you've got this

column1: Test Analyst / Senior Test Analyst - Mainframe Tester
column2: NEC Software Solutions (India) is looking forTest Analyst / Senior Test Analyst - Mainframe Tester to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey    A Test Analyst or Senior Test Analyst with expertise in Mainframe Testing is responsible for ensuring the quality and reliability of software systems, particularly those built on mainframe platforms.            1. Testing Expertise: As a Test Analyst, you are expected to have a strong understanding of mainframe systems and architectures. This includes knowledge of COBOL, JCL, VSAM, CICS, DB2, and other mainframe technologies commonly used in legacy systems.    2. Test Planning and Strategy: Develop test plans, test scenarios, and test cases based on software requirements and design documents. Collaborate with business analysts, developers, and other stakeholders to ensure comprehensive test coverage.    3. Test Execution: Execute test cases manually or using automated testing tools. Perform functional, integration, regression, and performance testing on mainframe applications. Analyze test results and identify defects or areas for improvement.    4. Defect Management: Document defects found during testing and track them to resolution using defect tracking tools like JIRA or HP Quality Center. Work closely with development teams to reproduce and troubleshoot issues.    5. Automation: Automate repetitive test cases and regression test suites using tools like Selenium, UFT, or Rational Functional Tester. Automate mainframe interactions using tools like IBM Rational Integration Tester (RIT) or similar.    6. Reporting: Prepare test summary reports, defect metrics, and other testing-related documentation for project stakeholders. Communicate test progress, issues, and risks to project managers and team members.

column2: A Functional Testing Professional is responsible for ensuring that software applications meet the functional requirements of the client or end-users. The job description for a Functional Testing Professional typically includes the following duties and responsibilities:     Test Planning: Develop test plans and test cases that cover all functional requirements of the software application.     Test Execution: Execute test cases to verify the functionality of the software application. This includes both manual and automated testing.     Defect Management: Log and track defects found during testing, working with development teams to ensure defects are fixed in a timely manner.     Test Reporting: Produce reports that summarize the testing progress, test results, and defects found during testing.     Test Automation: Design and develop automated tests using testing frameworks and tools.       Technical Skills:        Possess knowledge of programming languages, test automation tools, and testing frameworks.     Business Knowledge: Possess knowledge of the business domain and industry best practices to ensure that software applications meet business requirements.     Quality Assurance: Ensure that the software application is of high quality and meets customer expectations.The ideal candidate for a Functional Testing Professional role should possess excellent analytical skills, attention to detail, and the ability to work effectively in a team. They should also have strong communication skills.
column11: Functional testing

The candidate is expected to work closely with Team Leads or Software Development Managers and other key stake holders to ensure good quality, maintainable, scalable and high performing software applications are delivered to users.  Candidate should be coming from a strong technological background. Should be hands on and be able to work independently requiring minimal technical/tool guidance. Should be able to technically guide and mentor junior resources in the team.  Work closely with team members and vendor team to design and develop software. Should have good communication skill and strong positive outlook. Role will be responsible to gather requirements, analyse the requirement and prepare functional technical design document and work closely with development team to build critical components on regulatory reporting platform and ensuring that their implementation aligns with our end state architecture.  This person will also be responsible to make sure development team to align with business needs and as well as delivering Quality software. This is a hands-on role and will require experience in test driven development.
